title: Great service, lousy rating system
review:
Everyone knows that Netflix has a great selection, and the service is stellar. 

The problem comes with the app development team, and their change to the rating system. 

A thumbs up, thumbs down system is the most moronic and worthless system ever. Yet the rocket scientists who develop the app decided they were geniuses for implementing the least innovative, most ineffective way to measure a person’s opinion of movie selections. 

Without the ability to grade a movie on a scale, when you are looking at previously viewed movies, a thumbs up doesn’t tell you whether you loved it, or simply didn’t hate it. 

Which also means, their suggestions for you are worthless. As they have no way of gauging your level of interest in a particular type of movie, they only know you hated it or didn’t. 

Maybe that was their intent behind this Luddite move. This way, they don’t have to actually work at determining what movies to suggest, and can simply offer the ones that are most profitable for them to have you watch. 

Aside from that, yeah it’s great.

title: Content Turn-over
review: I’m so sick of Netflix getting rid of titles my family, specifically my kids, watch. At first glance it would appear they have a lot to watch (they do), but almost as soon as you find a TV show you like, Netflix gets rid of it. Lab Rats? Gone! Mighty Med? Gone! Veggie Tales? Gone! Many, many more titles; gone! I know some people would say this is not a review of the app and more an opinion about their service. I say they are two of the same. I’ve been a Netflix customer for a long time. Longer than I can remember. However, I’m not going to download 2, 3, 4 or more apps, more subscribe to (pay for) 2, 3, 4 or more services. The Netflix app is limited by their own P&P. They continue to remove titles and they don’t offer live tv. For these reasons, I suggest you are better off with one of their competitors and is they reason that I’m likely to cancel my account.

review:
The demographic in which shows I am recommended is a bit weird. Although I fully speak English, as I am not multilingual (but kudos to those who are), I keep getting targeted for foreign shows. In the end, it doesn’t deteriorate my opinion because I actually enjoy them.

Furthermore, the speed the shows are updated bother me quite a bit. I get that there is a variety of shows to pick from, which keeps it interesting, the pace in which it gets new episodes is incredibly annoying. (Not including Netflix specials.)

Other than that, and a few other smaller problems, it’s a good app and highly recommend it to those of all ages.

In terms of function, I often find I wish there was an easy way of removing movies from the “continue watching” list (you can do it on Brit Box which overall is a more primitive app): when you start watching sth and 10 mins into the film realize this is decidedly not your cup of tea, it seems you’re stuck with it. One can of course go to account settings on a browser, but it is tedious and I rarely access Netflix on the computer. 

Hope you can add a delete button in the corner of the thumbnail! That would be appreciated!

It’s very limiting and I feel like with this option for a more precise rating, I could have customized my watch history and list to something a little more “me.” And second; sometimes with each new update comes a new bug whether that being small or big, but it can be irritating especially when it’s something like a movie won’t play or you can’t tap on something, or you can’t add to your list, etc.
title: Two complaints for an otherwise Fantastic experience.

review: As my family peruses through the movies trying to find something that looks like it’s going to be a great action/adventure movie, we have to start the movie and watch 5-10 minutes of it only to find out that it only has English subtitles. Your description is in English and makes one think the movie will be also. A member of our family has limited eyesight and cannot read these subtitles and more and more of your offerings are not in English at all. It would be very helpful if it stated what language the movie is in so we don’t become disgruntled and waste so much time looking for something above sub-par. Netflix needs to get with the program and realize that thousands of Americans have visual limitations.

I think it’s ridiculous and I find myself not wanting to watch anything because I have so many things to keep track of just on this app. Time to get it together Netflix. I’m frustrated with your services which I used to love. I hope it gets better.
title: Why should I continue to pay

review:
Downloading a video is a very basic and simple task that plenty of free apps and websites seem to have no problem with. Not Netflix tho. I still get some downloads that have 10-20 second clips that won’t play and you have to skip past or it will buffer infinitely. The last video I downloaded, the first FIVE MINUTES was just audio and a black screen, when it would play at all. 

Besides the app issues, Netflix in general is a shadow of its former self, a service that tried to stay relevant by pumping out its own line of movies and tv series. Unfortunately, they mostly abandoned quality for the sake of quantity, and for its current price, it has a small selection of good titles that are buried beneath its own failures. I’m not wasting any more money on a dying service that can’t even handle such a simple operation as downloading

title: Like but boring

review:
Here’s how the recommendation system in Netflix works:

1. Netflix will recommend movies based on your watch history. (Good)

2. Netflix will annoy you with them. (Not so good)

3. You don’t feel like watching them. (Now that’s bad)

4. Netflix recommends a whole lot more movies based on your watch history (Bad)

5. You fall into a trap hole of recommended movies (Terrible)

A huge list of recommended TV shows that I DO NOT like:

Stretch Armstrong - 97% match
Johnny Test - 97% match
Zap Storm - 95% match
Dragons Race To The Edge - 98% match
Trolls The Beat Goes On! - 98% match
Beyblade Metal Fusion - 98% match
The Emoji Movie - 98% match

And a whole lot more movies and TV shows..

I also hate that some movies/TV shows are directed for little kids.

For example, Netflix classifies The Emoji Movie as a movie for kids 5-7. Well, some adults may want to watch this movie but if it says “For kids ages 5-7” the adult will know that he is too old for this movie. 

This is kinda like saying “This movie is NOT for people over the age of 7”

And that’ll just spoil the movie to older kids and adults.

Plz respond to me and say something that’ll be helpful and resolve this issue.

review: Please add the option to change the color and size of the subtitles. It can be hard to read them when they are on light colored backgrounds. review: I use the Netflix app all the time. It’s very user friendly. I also downloaded a movie that I took on an airplane last year. That’s a good feature. My big annoyance with the app is the automatic playing of videos when the app launches. At the top of the app, there’s a section that plays trailers for Netflix content that starts (complete with unwanted audio) within seconds of launching the app. I quickly scroll down the screen so that the video doesn’t play. From what I can tell, there’s no way to disable the auto-launch option. Please give us the option to either not launch the trailers or to launch them muted.
title: Good App with One Annoying Issue

review: Alright, off the bat I’m happy that Legend Of Korra is on American Netflix. I’ll be in America until March, so I’ll have time to watch it. But the sad thing is, I won’t be able to talk about Korra with my BFF Mackenzie, or any of her two sisters, because we’re Canadian and I’m only on vacation. I can’t wait until 2021 to talk about the monstrosity that is Makorra! I can’t wait a year to talk about Katara and Korra parallels with Mackenzie! Please get Korra on earlier on not just Canadian Netflix, but all countries. I am happy that my input counts and you are putting Korra on Netflix, but still. It will be a year. I’m feeling kind of like the star in A Wrinkle In Time that defeated The Black Thing but also lost its life in the process.
title: Mixed

review: I have watched many tv shows and I was very satisfied that most them are finished, but when I am watching one that is unfinished it seems you never keep up with the updates. For example, The Fosters it is an unfinished show on Netflix not sure on other apps, but it has been a very long time since an update has happened. A recommendation I suggest is that you should notify people if you will discontinue a show instead of leaving us dumbfounded if you will continue it or not. Honestly I love this app but I’m really starting to think if I should use another because of how slow it takes to update series. Or try to make notifications on which app is continuing the show more recent.
title: Please update

review:
Netflix has failed to put in effective secondary verification protocols to prevent your accounts from being compromised.

In less than 10-days my Netflix account has been compromised no less than THREE TIMES. Account email addresses changed, passwords changed, verification phone numbers removed, all with no secondary verification.

On the advice of Netflix the email address on the account was changed, and a phone number for secondary verification was added. I was told at that time future account changes would be verified through SMS. There has been no attempt by Netflix to send SMS messages with verification information to my mobile phone. In fact, the person I spoke to at Netflix suggested that the person who accessed my account had removed the phone number.
title: App OK but Netflix is not secure

review:
Especially on the windows version, Netflix has had a few problems but the most annoying one is, if I rewind too much or sometimes at all, it crashes, and then won’t open the next 5 or so times I click on it. I’ve tried everything and re-downloaded multiple times with the same issue.

And I say this for many, I also recommend making a widget of this, not only would that be useful in an advertising point but it really just would be nice to have;; an ex of something it could do would be to display recently watched or start a recently watched in picture-in-picture
title: Annoying bug

review: I’m so happy for this app specially these days where we have to stay indoors more. But I don’t always have internet access when I’m staying and because of this reason I download most of the episodes to watch it later. The problem is that I later found out that I can’t watch the downloaded episodes with my unofficial lighting to HDMI cable that is working fine with other apps. I didn’t try the streaming but even if it woks with streaming I will still have the internet access problem. I will now have to take my laptop with me to an internet accessible place to download so I can be able to later plug my laptop to the TV and watch. Please fix this. Thank you.
title: Lightning to HDMI cable

review: I don’t know why but for the past 6-8 months, more than half the movies I watch, the audio will just cut out. I then have to pause it, rewind it, and replay only for it to continuously do it throughout the movie. I have to end up watching something else because of this annoyance. Also, the past month, it defaults to the setting of “narrative” so I then have to pause the movie and click on the setting so that it takes it off. No idea why it suddenly defaults to that and no clue how to change the default to just playing the movie without it narrating it.  I’m to the point where I just might cancel this subscription and just stay on Prime Video instead, where the quality of movies is much better without these issues.
title: Audio suddenly stops

review:
Netflix is an amazing app. They have great shows to watch and I really enjoy the app. I have a few suggestions for the app though. 

First, we should have more sections. The kids section has a bunch of shows, but a lot of them are more aimed towards 3-8 year olds instead of all ages. There should be more sections like the toddler section for 1-6 year olds, a kids section for 7-10 year olds, a preteen section for 11-14 year olds, teen section for 15-17 year olds, and the adult section for everyone 18+. I feel like it would just be way more organized that way. The teen section should have a few cuss words as long as it isn’t excessive. 

Two, please make a setting where you can turn off the “Are you still watching” prompt. It honestly gets so annoying when I’m watching a show that I’ve been sitting and watching for hours. 

There is probably many more things that could be improved about Netflix, but these are the two suggestions I could think of and quickly type.
title: Amazing! I have a few suggestions, though.

review: I’ve been using Netflix for years and it’s a terrific app don’t get me wrong. But for the last few days I’ve been having a bug issue, especially on Mobile. Lately, if I happen to pause an episode and leave the app, whenever I return there’s an issue. It will completely restart the episode back to the beginning, and so I’ll have to voluntarily scroll through the episode until I find the place I was once at. This is happen for new shows I have not watched as well as rewatching previous ones. Please fix this issue asap! Thanks!
title: Great but having a bug issue

review: I love netflix, but these two new additions could be better. The brightness thing on the side is just plain annoying. I specifically set it to full brightness and then I left the app and came back and the brightness was at around 90% and I keep accidentally touching the brightness bar. The screen lock is a nice feature, but it could honestly be better. You should at least be able to pause and double tap to go forward or back on screen lock. It’s annoying having to take off screen lock to pause and fast forward.
title: Brightness and screen lock

review:
Hey I was on the last episode of the vampire diaries and I go to finish it and it is not there anywhere I tried searching and it is it there. I look on my sister’s account and it pulls up on there? Then I was rewatching Gilmore Girls and I finished it and I tried looking it up and it was not there? So can pls respond and tell me what is wrong. I really want to finish The. Vampire diaries. Respond ASAP

I found the reason why. I was looking at my account and I say that my account was changed to kids account because my played a joke on my to see what I would do because she knows I love the vampire diaries. But problem solved.
title: The vampire diaries

review: Netflix used to have loads of good movies, and I could watch for centuries on, but now there’s just too many originals. They took out all of the good movies like Legally Blonde, Footloose, Mean Girls, Heathers, etc. and instead switched them out for a ton of bad Netflix originals. Don’t get me wrong, some of them are okay, though the majority are movies with no plot and just overall boring. It’s obviously cheaper for Netflix to just make their own movies, but what about entertainment wise? We want the good movies back, not the new ones Netflix filmed themselves. Often, I find myself scrolling though Netflix just to leave and go on another site to choose some other movie(s) to watch. Netflix is an okay site, but its movies are just less and less interesting and fun to watch.
title: Too many originals

review: Was never told when I signed up, that you could not use certain devices. When I bought a smart TV off of someone at a Garage Sale, I wasn't told it had already had a Netflix free trail on it. So when I signed up for Netflix on my phone, I was never asked if any of the devices I have had use Netflix free trail at some point in time. I tried to use it on the TV the next day, it said I had to pay  for the usage before my free trail was over. They were trying to bully me into paying for something that was supposed to be free for 30 days. That is one of their many hidden details they do not tell you about. So people beware. If you bought a Smart TV off of someone and they had Netflix on it before, you will have your free trail revoked and they will try and force you to pay. Wish I knew about this before I signed up.
title: Free trail
I love Netflix!
review: I’ve been watching Netflix since about 2009. I loved it then and I still love it now! I just wish that you would add some of your shows back. I understand that there’s a contract and it’s hard to do, but I still wish you could do that. But I think you’ve just removed some of them just because you want to. For example, Littlest Pet Shop and My Little Pony (I know they are baby shows 😂)  are made by the same company (Hasbro). Yet you removed Littlest Pet Shop and kept My Little Pony!! I wish you wouldn’t remove shows just because you want to because some of those shows mean a lot to people. Anyways, other than that I love Netflix 😁.

title: PRO CHOICE
review: Netflix is a great source of entertainment and honestly when I heard that they’re going shading the abortion laws in Georgia I couldn’t have been happier. It’s important when big corporations put an opinion out there and go for what they believe is right. To anyone who is saying that it’s just their job to entertain and you’re going to stop watching and unsubscribe just because you’re pro life, then just be quiet. They have millions of more customers that agree with what they’re trying to do,  support their choice AND love their entertainment. Netflix is standing up and it’s good to say that it’s not for the wrong thing.

title: I love the service but I have some feedback. . .
review: I love the service but I think that there is one feature that would make it even better.  When you have a family account your are able to make up to five profiles but there is no way to add a password to them.  Being one of three children I have experienced first hand the anger that comes when you log onto Netflix and see that your sibling has gone onto your account and made you lose your place in a show.  Netflix needs to add a password to the profiles. It dosent have to be mandatory when you set up a profile but it should definitely be available.  It would just about the only flaw that I can find with Netflix. :)

Like with the flash their is 4 season and you only get 2 I am from South Africa and this is the case with all series and I understand that like with the flash they are still making season 4 so obviously you can't put season 4 up yet but atleast put season 3 with ended more then a year ago. title: One of the most used apps with the least features
review:
The Netflix mobile app lacks so much in functionality. There is no longer a rewind feature, never had a fast forward feature and the scrubbing slider doesn’t allow for small increments of FF or RWD. Would be is a double tap to the left of the play button rewinded and the right side respectively. Even allowing for an up and down slide to control volume would be nice. 

I find it such a hassle to watch anything on my mobile phone because of the extreme lack of innovation. Allowing for picture picture outside the app may be a difficult task to create with the app, but it’s not even supported within the app. Really hope these ideas are considered in order to make a more user friendly experience.

title: App for iPhone is useless
review:
Update: Heyyy, there we go. Finally got this bad boy working on iPhone. Danke.

Update: The Sept 21st update hasn't fixed anything. The Netflix app is still completely unusable on my iPhone.

I've been unable to use this app on my phone for weeks. Receive "Unable to connect to Netflix. Please try again later" when attempting to watch any title whatsoever. Wifi connection is fine, have updated, uninstalled/reinstalled. Nothing helps. If you're looking to purchase this service for the express purpose of watching anything on your mobile device, don't. It's a rip off.

title: Some issues
review:
I really like Netflix, I have been using it for many years but I have a few issues. 
1. Subtitles
I like to watch all my shows with CC but I have noticed time and time again that the subtitles are just wrong. I don’t know what’s going on with that but it’s really annoying to hear a different thing then you are reading.
2.
And a pretty obvious one is that you all always get rid of really good shows🥲 and I understand that like it’s not always up to you or whatever but come on I mean. Sometimes there is hardly anything to watch. I will have a show I want to watch and it’s never on Netflix but I can always find it somewhere else😃
3.
So many series are incomplete. You will have like the first 2 seasons then not the rest??? Like who wants to watch a show if there is only half of it. It’s incredibly annoying and quite stressful to have to find the show somewhere else after you’ve watched half of it on Netflix😣
4.
I’ve seen a lot of reviews about this but I’m yeah stop removing good anime😭😭😭

All that said I still really like Netflix but there is some problems😗✌️

title: Show keeps erroring on iPad, but through Blu-ray app.
review: I think we need an iPad update for this app. Overall, I,like Netflix. However, two things. First, the iPad app keeps having issues playing and keeps showing an error. I have restarted my iPad and unloaded and reloaded the app to no avail. It is an iPad Pro 2017, so it should not be having these issues. When I play on my blue ray, I do not have this problem; same WiFi network for both. Second, I wish you would keep good shows like "Anne of Green Gables" and "When Calls the Heart" going. There is enough darkness and depression in the world without adding to it with the new slew of dark movies/shows. But please, try not to make them overly-cheesy!

title: iphone 7:Auto play / browse phone while  dock connector
review: Netflix, I enjoy your app everyday from my iphone 7 connected to a dock connector. the app runs smoothly but it would be amazing if you guys allowed an auto play after TV shows and movies like you guys do for ones using other means of streaming. title: Netflix Television Shows
review:
I love looking at television shows by seasons,episodes, especially without commercials . What’s lovely most of all you can choose episodes by going back through what you might of missed.
 I’d encourage you to pick movies from every kind of cgenre  gangster,romantic ,even how to do things can be found through live streaming get any of promoted Netflix offers.
 It’s reasonable with monthly payments, 
Customer Service Reps are very knowledgeable helpful they want you a satisfied customer. 
I’ve been an  Netflix faithful for over 20 years with no complaints or unfinished issues.

title: New button suggestions
review: Hey! Can you please add “seen” and “not interested” buttons to the content? For example, I started watching a show, and didnt like it. Removed it from my list. But it still “reminds” me to “keep watching” it from where I left off. I want it to disappear from my homepage. Also, not see it ever again, unless I specifically search for it. Or a recent season of a show that I watched on another platform keeps popping up because I watched the first season on netflix. But I’ve already seen it and dont want it to keep popping up. (Rating a thumbs up or down is not enough to make the content go away.) This makes new and interesting content very hard to find. Thanks in advance!

This update is an improvement in many aspects, all the options are now on the bottom instead of scattered around the screen. The play button is now in the middle, making it easier and more satisfying to use. The removal of the 10-second rewind button is now really starting to get annoying though, because I want to rewatch a funny part of an episode, but now I have to manually move the dial and it moves it back like a minute behind. It gets to the point where I regret even moving it back because I forget what I even wanted to see. Bring back the rewind button, and add a fast forward button. That’d be cool.
title: Cool Update.. but

review: I love using Netflix but lately I’ve been dreading all the new updates. Firstly, my “continue watching” tab is constantly moving making it aggravating to have to scroll to look for it. Just make it the first thing I see! Also, I dislike the fact that content plays automatically if you hover over it for too long. Most of the the time whatever is on the spotlight is not something I’m remotely interested in watching. A little more customization on the home page would be appreciated. Lastly, going back to the old rating system would be appreciated. Sometimes a thumbs down is too harsh for a movie but giving it a thumbs up is no good either.

title: Awesome!

review: I don’t really have any issues with the content on Netflix or how it operates, but before you could access your account information through the app. Which plan you had, billing date, cost, change password, etc. Now you have to go to the internet to check these things?? Also, the “Help” section consists of the phone number to customer service - not actually any help topics to read about and possibly find the solution yourself. You have to actually CALL someone, which is not always convenient. Why on earth would I want to go to a different platform to check my information when I could do it before on the app? Why would I want to call customer service and be on hold when I could browse solutions? These are major steps backwards for an app, Netflix.

title: Great but one thing

review: 1 Star for visibility. Before my flight, I tapped to download several episodes of Breaking Bad. It displayed a warning saying that I could only download them 1 more time. I continued, saw them begin to download, complete, etc. On my flight, I opened up the Netflix app, and they were all missing. Later episodes were there, but not the ones I specifically downloaded. I was furious. I got off the flight and tried to re-download, and now it says I can’t do so until next year. Unbelievable. It could have something to do with their “smart download” feature, which I’ve now turned off. But really? You delete an episode I specifically downloaded even though I hadn’t pressed ‘play’ once?

title: Problems starting the app

review: The movie options under my profile are extremely different from the movie options under my husband’s profile. I watch a variety of genres with varied subject matter. Rather than having to swipe left to view the movies under each section, just place each genre of movies on a page without the subcategories (e.g. new movies, classic). This way, more can fit on the screens and all of the options are available for everyone.

Content is repeated in the various menus on the home screen.  Please consider a new method of organising content so it doesn’t present the same shows again and again. title: We have enough sections
review:
Great app. All those who are saying we need more sections appear silly. Of course there should be restrictions at some point - luckily we have that in the form of a kids section. 

The idea of preteen, teen, young adult, etc is illogical. If you are afraid of cussing, kissing etc., please register yourself as a child because that is the sort of content you will likely be viewing without these things. In addition, if you are not a child in real life you should be able to make the distinction between kid( or extremely sensitive person) content and adult (that which is not for kids) content, read the movie’s ratings and descriptions. Look up what content the movie contains. You, who are likely not a child, can do it. I believe in you. 

If you cannot make any of these distinctions don’t watch the shows or movies that you are afraid of. Luckily we have something to make that easier - the kids section.

Roasted. Mic drop. Over and out.
:)

title: Suggestion
review:
I absolutely love Netflix. I was reading a review about a suggestiin of locking a profile with a pin so no one can change or enter. I really like the idea so I decided to share it so it has a better chance of being seen.  
I too have a suggestion...
Netflix has a section where you can see shows or movies that can be coming soon. How about a “leaving soon section” where you can see shows or movies that will be moved from Netflix in a couple weeks. That way people can watch/ rewatch a show or movie before it is taken. I would love this.

title: New Content?
review: I am a big fan of Netflix and I love it’s content but sometimes I get frustrated. I feel like the algorithm doesn’t give me new shows to watch. I get bored very easily and like to watch a lot of different things, shows and movies that I never heard of before but when I scroll through my feed on my iPhone it recommends stuff that I’ve already watched, am still watching, and is very similar to what I have seen. I think it would be really cool if there was a randomly generated suggestion tab that will introduce me to new and interesting content. If this feature was created I would probably never stop watching.

title: What could be better
review: I don't usually write reviews but I felt as though this was a the thing to do to get  Netflix attention. I'm sure you've heard of the ideas of a comment section for Netflix I don't mind this idea I actually really like this idea. Another thing I wanted to bring up is the fact that the new update wear have to scroll up and down  for Netflix recommendation is not very convenient I think 💭 the better way of handling this is to scroll side to side . Other than that I love Netflix I actually count on it because I feel like it is more "diverse" on it better than HBO and Is more reliable than specific channels apps

title: Perfecto
review: Netflix is overall a great app, and I love how they include s many different genres and options for you to choose from. The only thing that I would want Netflix to add ares shows such as the Simpsons etc... After watching on Netflix for many years now, I’ve observed upon seeing that there are many great features to this app, and I would recommend it to anyone ranging from people who only like to watch just one show (Such as “The Office” for me) over and over again,  all the way to people who don’t really care or don’t know what their type of genera is yet.

title: Stupidly limiting
review: This current user experience is limiting and frustrating. The main page shows your usual recommendations, which is to say the same 20 or so promoted titles, assuming you’re a real person who gravitates towards a few different genres. No longer can you browse by genre, aside from whatever the Netflix algorithm deems worthy to look at. There isn’t a real reason to have multiple sections when “popular on netflix,” “trending,” “recommended for you,” and “similar to _____” all contain roughly the same titles. It’s fine if you only want what is currently popular, or have a specific title in mind, but it’s stupid I can’t even do the work to find more under the radar options.

title: Glitch sometimes while adding movies to my list
review: Movies play fine and I’m able to find movies quickly with the my list, categories page, and ‘similar movies’ panel on selected movies. However, I attempted to bump some high-priority movies in my my-list to the top so I’d remember to watch them first, by removing and readding them to the my-list, and only after I was done did I realize that not all of them readded to the top of my list and I’d in fact deleted them! I can’t remember every one I removed. There is a bug apparently where sometimes you will tap the ‘add to my list’ button and it will change to ‘in my list’ when it hasn’t been added to your list! Frustrating glitch!

title: Good service, app needs work ASAP.
review:
Netflix service overall is great. Big selection, fair price. 
The categories have always needed help (remove stand up specials from Comedy now that they have their own section; put a Movies filter on, or at least have a Movie category), but it’s still good on the whole. 
My beef is with this version of the app. After this last update, it won’t connect after the first time it’s used. On the second attempt, I’ll get a network error message (no issue with any other app or wireless connection). The only fix is to uninstall the app and redownload. It’s frustrating enough that I’ve cancelled my account and I’m using other apps for TV and movies until they fix it. 
Once this is fixed, I’ll happily be back.

Please because I can’t watch my favorite Netflix Animes, movies, etc. So I hope you see this and fix it because I really want to watch something, I’ve been wondering why it didn’t let me watch Netflix but now I do and I don’t like the update where you need to have an iPhone 13 to just watch a show or anything like that. Like I said please fix it so I can watch my things again 😞 I really miss Netflix.
title: This is unfair, also please read!

review: My entire family has been subscribed to Netflix for years because of the awesome family movies, funny tv shows, and great original films; but when I found the movies “The Last Hangover” and “The First Temptation of Christ” I was very upset with Netflix. Why would you not only allow movies that disrespect someone’s belief to be added into your library, but also help fund it because it is a Netflix film which honestly makes the entire situation worse. I just don’t understand why you would believe it’s okay to disrespect Christianity and no other belief. Just because you do not respect it doesn’t mean that others have the same mindset as you. Hopefully Netflix rights this wrong, but even they don’t what you sow, you must reap.
title: Very disappointed by disrespect for personal beliefs

review: I’m not usually one to write reviews however I felt a need this time. I watched Newsies for the first time on Netflix and within a month or so you took it off. I was so frustrated when I wanted to watch it again but it was gone. Please add it back to the American shows. Also if there are other professionally recorded broadway shows, like Bandstand, please add them to Netflix as well. It will be a great way for those who don’t live in or near New York to watch them and then there’s people like me who watch them multiple times over. Bandstand and Newsies both were shown in movie theaters through Fathom Events by the way. Thank you.
title: Broadway Shows

review: When I look at the new shows or whatever I think I’ll see anime but what I see is more other stuff than anime people who like anime look at this I like romance, action, and adventure but I watched all the romance and all the other anime which makes me mad 😡 so I have to wait a couple weeks till I can watch a anime because it’s so boring when you just watched and you watch it a day or little bit later so I won’t give you more stars till I see more romance anime but for tv PG me and my little brother watch anime so pls pls bring more and I’ll give ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️so pls just bring a lot more one anime a week pls 🥺 I love anime (ps I’m to scared to watch the promised never land):):(
title: Need more anime 😡

review: After reviewing all tv and movie apps - verses shows, movies quality and price . Hands down Netflix comes on top . The apps the price constantly goes up each year. They either add other features or channels - and with out you realizing it your cost per month has gone up . Or the video can’t load or there’s a error check back. Or you have the app paying for it now if you want to watch another session or a certain movie - yep you pay extra. Not with Netflix the monthly fee is all there is - no unexpected fee’s or surprises !!
title: Best App all around

review:
I feel like if you have had a movie in your system that people can watch then it should stay there. 4 of my favorite movies (dark crystal, sweeney Todd, Charlie and the chocolate factory, and below her mouth) have recently been removed and it sucked when I went to go watch them (like I usually do) and they weren’t there....  I also feel there should be a wider selection of Tim Burton movies, but my main concern and reason for giving three stars is due to the changes and removal of movies without warning.

-reading some of the recent reviews I see that many people are also having an issue with the removal of movies and shows.
title: A little disappointed with recent changes

review: If you are looking to get Netflix right now, I advise you to wait until Covid has mostly blown over. I have had Netflix for a very long time now and have been very satisfied. Of course when we are streaming on the television, it sometimes would load but it was easily fixed by going out and coming back in. Now, and this started when Covid did, it gets stuck every time without fail. Sometimes it gets stuck on 20% but most of the time it gets stuck on 24%. It works fine on our other devices but we have found streaming Netflix on our television completely useless. I am hoping that it will get better when Covid settles down.
title: Don’t Get During Covid

review:
I recently downloaded a movie rather than watching it live because of all the extra Internet traffic due to the COVID-19 virus. So many of my neighbors are at home now, and everyone seems to be streaming this and that.

The movie downloaded fairly quickly, so I was able to get it during a time of day when the Internet wasn’t too busy. But later, when I watched it the resolution was terrible in many scenes. It was just like I would experience watching when the Internet is too busy, and the pictures became pixelated and very difficult to see. I simply don’t see why this should happen in a downloaded movie.
title: Why should resolution in a downloaded movie suffer?

review: I love Netflix a lot but it has it’s downfalls. When I try anime they don’t always have all the season. For example Haikyuu originally has 4 seasons yet they only put 2 seasons on there. Same as HunterXHunter they only put 2 season on there. I want to have the full anime experience and watch the full anime instead of some. Can you please start putting all of the season on there. I really do enjoy watching anime. As long as the other animes people love watching. Y’all can put all the season on the other tv shows yet y’all can’t do it for anime. Thank you for your time. :).
title: I love Netflix !

review: For example, you seriously need to consider parents who are using this App, for example I’d switch to children’s mode, but inappropriate posters of adult rated movies still show up on the screen! Imagine coming back from work after your kids finished watching Max and Ruby and there is a poster of two naked men spooning in bed 🤦🏻‍♀️ I suggest that you guys should have a parental guidance or security option where a parent could hide a show, or lock up the whole adult content.. It’s annoying and frustrating 😫 please do something about this.. If it were a free app, I wouldn’t complain, but parents are paying customers as well!
title: I like it and all but there are several things bothering me

review: For the love of god please format all movies and tv shows to fill the entire screen. Nobody wants to lose the top and bottom of their screen. When you watch stuff on an iPad you can either lose an inch at the top and bottom of the screen or you can go to full screen and lose much of the sides. Like in a documentary using full screen you miss the names of people because they are cut off on the sides. I want to see everything and have my entire screen utilized too. It’s almost 2019 and having two black lines on your screen is so 1990’s. But it’s “wide screen!” Nobody cares! Please fix it!
title: Formatting/ screen size ratios

review:
I did the free trail to test out Netflix.
I successfully downloaded the two seasons of shows available of a tv show to watch later without internet access.  
The first two times I could play the downloaded videos.
The next time I started the ap I got a blank screen with a spinning symbol and the upper right had the word signin.

With the ap still open, when I drive to a location with internet access the ap now showed the normal screen and I could view a video.

When I didn’t have internet access only about 1/3 or 1/2 the time would the normal screen come up and I could play videos.  The rest of time I could do nothing until I had internet access.

Totally worthless.  

And support, after 30 minutes talking to several people could not even understand the issue (asking stupid questions like which video would not play - after I said I started the ap and only saw a spinning screen with signin in the upper right corner and telling me netflix will not play downloaded files without being connected to the internet after I said sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn’t).

I canceling my trial.
title: Will not play downloaded files - support worthless

review: This was a great idea and app a long time ago. It seems pretty useless now. They’ve removed ratings. They don’t let you search in any reasonable way unless you’re on a desktop. Now all the new movies are busy and won’t load. They don’t have enough copied licensed. Odd because they made some of the movies. I guess they don’t think their own movies are good enough to show. Mostly, just agree. You can watch what you want other places. It seems like the whole Netflix app is designed to promote a few second rate movies they cranked out. No thanks. Update: when I tried to cancel they said “something must have happened” they kept charging my card for months. I’m done with this. Netflix is a criminal organization in my mind. And they aren’t even good at it.
title: This was a great idea and app a long time ago

review: “My List” has always been the worst part of the Netflix app. Of all the great steps forward Netflix has made, My List is way to easy to get out of control. To manage things a little better, and because there’s no rhyme or reason sometimes to how they organize the list, I make profiles based on themes I like: Comedy, Documentaries, Action.... There should be a way to move titles between them. I’ll see a recommendation, save it, but it’s on the wrong profile. Now I need to log out, into the other, add it there, and remove on the 1st profile — too many steps for a logical option that should have been available years ago.
title: Why can’t you move titles between profiles?

review: NETFLIX SUPPORT—> As everyone knows, Netflix is THE app. You binge-watch, it’s become a daily thing in most peoples lives and also a meme. I love it! But please if Netflix Support sees this, what happened to fast-forwarding? There was an update a few weeks ago that let you double-tap to fast forward 10 seconds, but today my app updated and its back to the old, annoying way with only back tracking 10 seconds at a time. PLEASE GO BACK!!! I loved that feature, and also loved the pause button right in the middle. Is this a permanent update, or is my phone just glitching? Anyway, pLEASE HELP!!🤞🏻🤞🏻
title: Loved it, until they took away fast forwarding

review: Netflix is like one of my favorite apps to watch shows and movies on. It was great! But there’s a problem on the app. When I would want to go watch a movie or show on my iPad, I would hit play. And then it says something like network error. It says there is a problem connecting to it. It works on my tv, but not on my device. I gave it 4 stars because it is a great app, and because that tiny bug that I know you can fix. It just make me disappointed that I can’t watch anything if that thing keeps showing up. Please fix it, and write back to me if you can. I love your app, it’s amazing, once again.😀
title: Disappointed

review:
As much as I like this app, several things stand out to me as needing improvement. Firstly, we need a skip forward button. It doesn’t make sense to only be able to rewind something with a button press. I’m tired of having to scroll through the time bar to do this.
 Secondly, we need a better review system. Just a thumbs up or thumbs down isn’t specific enough. 
Thirdly, why can’t we browse the genres like we used to be able to. We used to be able to select a genre, sci fi mystery for example, and go through a list of every title on Netflix that was labeled such. Now all we get is s what Netflix decides are the top titles of those genres.
title: There are improvements to be made

review: I love Netflix don’t get me wrong. However I’ve watched season one of Riverdale when it came out on Netflix and have been waiting for season two as I do not wish to watch it on television. People have been saying that episodes of it have already come out but when I check it the episodes aren’t there. I tried to see if I needed an update for it, if it is just a problem with my phone and it is on another device, uninstalling the app, and even looking on the internet if someone has this problem as well but nothing has worked. I do not know who else to contact except for Netflix. Please help me solve this issue and thank you so much for reading this.
title: Please help me

review: I love Netflix and all, but now my opinion has changed on it!! Because this quarantine they’ve removed all my favourite shows and now I’m only left with super horrible, unfunny, unoriginal, hard to watch shows that I’m pretty sure are only on there because the nine year olds keep rewatching them!!! I’m about ready to end my subscription with Nexflix as I’m sure a lot of people are too because of how bad all the shows are. I’ve also noticed that Netflix removed all of the big lgbtq+ hits/ the ones with a small same sex romance. Hmm why is that Netflix??? So you guys are homophobic now huh? Maybe bring back “I’m Not Okay With This” and “The Society” and me and all the other fans we’ll talk but till then you’re homophobic to me:)
title: Bring back the good shows!!!!!

review: Soo... how do I put this? Alright, so I wanted to watch Coraline for like the hundredth time after a while of not watching anything at all, and I could not find the movie at all. Not in the search, and not in my list, and I got pretty upset about that. I wonder... Is there really a good reason to go around removing movies or series from the app? I mean, some people have gotten their favorite movies removed, and I know I’m not the first and last to say this. Even if the app is great, there’s that, and let’s say “older” movies are quite harder to watch anywhere at all. I just hope that the admins won’t take more movies down.
title: Removal of good movies

review:
The app works pretty fast and stable except for rare buffering issues, but that’s everything. Fairly cheap for all you can get. Support is usually pretty cool.

There are 2 bones of contention.
1. Netflix seems far more interested lately in “Netflix Originals” and, let’s face it, they’re not all “Black Mirror” so maybe go back to uploading other stuff. Which brings us to...
2. Kindly stop having only a few seasons of something. If you’re going to have it, have all of it. If you can’t or won’t have all of it, get rid of the part of it. I hate getting into new shows only to find out a season is missing.
title: Good Overall

review: This app is good but there is something wrong with it it won't let me download anything I pay for this  to work and it's not doing a good job if it's not gonna doe it's job and still pay you for awful services then this app isn't a very good app for it to pay you there is a Hurricane coming tomorrow and I want to download my things before I I don't have internet connection I expect an upgrade within the next 2 hours if I don't get it by then I will stop paying you will see what's going to happen next it's a great app  but it doesn't work as well as it should do I expect my upgrade within 2hours don't forget thx
title: Good but....

review: This is a fantastic app to watch movies and tv shoes. Here is something that would make it even better. So for some movies (not all) there are alternate endings, for example I Am Legend has an alternate ending. It would be great if you could add a setting in the information area where you can watch the alternate ending. Also if you can could you do something so if someone adds a movie to their list than the movie won’t leave their list even if you take it off of Netflix? That would also be fantastic. If you take my advice, thank you so much.
title: This is a great app

review:
I love Netflix. I’m not going anywhere but when it comes to letting my kids watch it why can’t I have more control? The only thing I can do is limit it to what Netflix deems appropriate. Would it be so hard for them to let me block poor quality, violent and rude shows from showing up as options? There are so many good and educational shows that I want to let them watch! Please let me block shows!!
Furthermore while it hasn’t been a problem yet I can restrict a user to be only able to watch kid shows but there is no way to prevent my kids from just switching to an adult user. Please make a way to block switching users without a password.
title: Could be better!

review: Hand down the best video streaming service. A very large library of great exclusive Netflix exclusives like Punisher, Stranger Things, Godless, etc. They even some amazing exclusive movies. Large selection of regular TV shows and movies. Streaming quality is amazing and looks great even with slow internet. Has HDR/Dolby Vision support for supported devices while most streaming services don’t. Movies and shows look amazing in HDR something to see in person on an iPhone X. Fast loading times when loading video. Finally great customer service! Highly recommend!
title: Best video steaming service!

review:
A lot of “old” features that were to me essential have disappeared.

1. Star rating system. A thumbs dozen or up isn’t enough. I just don’t want to know if I liked it. I want to know how much I liked it. Was it super amazing or just ok? Also it helped knowing how much people liked it overall and in general. Those star rating were always very accurate,

2. Letting us know when a series or movie is leaving. How could you take that away? It’s super hard to find the list that shows what’s coming and going each month. It’s not readily available. It should be in the app but you’ve also taken away the warnings on the series/movies pages themselves. What’s worse than staring something new and in a week it’s gone? At least if I knew it was leaving I could either binge or not start it in the first place if I know I won’t have the time to finish.

3. What happened to the back/forward 10 second buttons? Those were super convenient! I HATE having to use the slider bar to rewind and fast forward. Why’d you take those down?!
title: Bring back old features

review:
I know I’m not the first to say this. PLEASE ADD A TEEN CHOICE!!!
All of the teen shows are on the adult choice ,but there’s still Tv-MA stuff and rated R movies on it, and some parents don’t want their kids to see that stuff! And the kids section should be called “little kids” section. Like, shows like “Alexa and Katie” (which I love) shouldn’t be at the same age choice as freaking “Baby Bum”. There should be a kids section, preteen section, teen section AND adult section. Or at least a teen section with shows that aren’t for little kids!!! PLEASE! I’ve been using Netflix forever and this has annoyed me for that time. Please even consider this,
anonymous spice

title: I love it

review: Two stars are given because of the recent playback error’s continuously post for pre-much almost all of my viewing selections. For instance the Marvel animes and cobra Kai and countless others that play for no more than a minute or two before giving playback errors. Considering it’s been three weeks since the last patch update so you need to get on the ball and wake up do your job with the patches and pay attention to customer complaints. You’re losing customers and will continue to lose customers to other streaming services they can better handle the situation. Thus the reason why I will be leaving Netflix for a while along with others until you can manage app upkeep.
title: Consistent recent playback errors

review: Ok for starters I love love love LOVE this app! You can watch so many shows and movies! It is sooooo fun and awesome!! I have this on my phone, iPad, and TV! I watch Netflix every day why? Because it has everything that you can imagine!! You can make kid profiles so kids don’t watch anything inappropriate and so that they can find what they like! You can also make adult profiles that has all of the shows and movies!! I also love how you can search stuff up and how you can download shows and movies! Netflix is the best and I HIGHLY recommend it!! So five stars!! ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️!!!
title: Best app ever !!!

review: Netflix has usually made good changes with their updates, but some of the most recent one isn’t!  While watching a TV show, you will get to the end of the episode.  I’m used to reaching to the upper left corner to exit the show. Now, however, one must go searching for the exit button. Why can’t you keep things generally in the same position with each app change? It’s annoying and very frustrating and time consuming to the viewer. Remember, we PAY for the Netflix service. It’s not like it’s a free app or air TV.  Just keep this in consideration for future “improvements“ you make.  Thanks.
title: Not all good

review: Let me set something straight. I love Netflix itself. It has a huge variety of shows. A little lax on child protection but that’s not the reason for my bad review. It is because of Netflix blocking all users using VPNs. Due to many international copyright laws, citizens of other countries have a separate Netflix from US Residents. And many shows are blocked on their Netflix resulting in people illegally using VPNs to access the US Netflix selection. And people like me use VPNs for legal uses, like security or work cannot access Netflix. So many innocents are casualties of this war on illegal VPN users. So Netflix, are you going to continue to fight a battle that Will eventually lead to you losing customers, or are you lift the VPN ban. I will change my review when you do.
title: VPN Blocks Ruin Netflix

review: i love netflix and binge watch shows fast and incredibly easy. there is nothing wrong with netflix in my opinion... besides the fact that none of the old amazing disney shows are on it, along with cartoons i used to watch as a kid. sometimes i just want a throwback and wish that i could watch shows like tom & jerry, suite life in deck, drake & josh, austin & ally, scooby doo, and so many more. i also wish game of thrones was on netflix. i understand some of these are impossible to get but i would love netflix so much more if these shows were added! i love this app so much! thanks

review: For probably two or three months, when I watch episodes of shows on Netflix, the continue watching does not update so if I click a show from continue watching it will take me back to episodes which I’ve already watched. Quite often when I click details to select an episode, the episodes will not be updated although this is not always the case. This problem occurs on my iPad, MacBook, and smart tv. This problem is quite obnoxious because the continue watching feature is useful. Otherwise there are few problems, but I hope this glitch will be addressed promptly.
title: Shows not keeping up with episodes I watch

review:
I want Digimon back I want Jurassic park back I want The lost world Jurrasic park And Lastly add Jurrasic park three back I loved Jurrasic park and digimon but if you want me happy again without bringing in those things bring in Godzilla 2000-Godzilla2004 but fairytale has 7 seasons and what’s taking so long to get all seasons of ninjago sorry I’m just a big fan at least you put in King Kong Peter Jackson if there is Kong 2012 add it to Netflix I know you have to spend money for shows and movies but please try to do this

I Love Netflix but this has to come back

title: Please add this back😥and add this😑

review:
I was adding titles to my watchlist from a review article, which means I was using the iPad Pro’s native web browser and the app. I did a search, clicked on the icon in the search results, added it to my list, closed the movie page (which takes you back to the search results page), then clicked on another movie. That movie page was blank, as it turned out to be for every one I tried.

I gave up after many tries, and went to do other stuff, but nothing else that used WiFi worked. I spent more than an hour doing everything I could think of, including shutting down my tablet many times snd rebooting the modem. When I did get things to work, it was temporary. Until I removed the Netflix app, that is. Then everything worked fine.

I tried going through the website, but doesn’t allow me to add to my watchlist or to watch anything. It seems that no matter what I want to do (except manage account details), they just throw up a “Get App” screen which I can’t close.

It is just too much hassle, and I am ready to pitch Netflix, which makes searching insanely difficult through the tv.
title: Prevents WiFi working with other apps after search
I used to love Netflix but now it’s not working
review: Recently every time i go onto netflix my closed captions are turned off when i always leave them on. i have never had this problem and now all of a sudden and i have to re-turn them on every single time i watch a show. and also when i try to skip through my show it won’t show me what scene i will try to go to it just moves ahead. i have powered off my phone, deleted and re-got netflix, and tried turning my wifi on and turning it off to LTE and nothing is working. i updated netflix and this is what happened and i am not happy about it.

title: Issues tho
review:
I love Netflix. I download shows to watch on the train but lately, its been giving me an issue. Its been saying "failure to connect" every time I use it. I'm at home with wifi, out the house w/ data, on the plane w/ wifi, etc. when I use to be on the train, I was still able to use Netflix. Now I can't. I been having this issue since friday. What do I do? I've gone on airplane mode to restart everything, disconnect from the wifi and even after resetting my phone. 

Btw: I just updated the app today, and its still giving me the same issues.

title: What about Anime?
review: Netflix is amazing don’t get me wrong but when it comes to updating Anime it’s not the best....There are so many good anime shows that I would love to watch and I can- its just that it doesn’t always have all of the seasons. Let’s take Fairytail for instance it has a total of 8 seasons but only 1 is available on Netflix. And it’s not just this show either Haikyu has 4 seasons but only 2 are available and so on and so on I could seriously make a list. I’m not bashing on The Netflix team because they are working their butts off as well but the Anime genre has some room for improvement regarding the installments of seasons

title: Why take off so many good shows?
review: Ok, so I’m guessing we all agree that Netflix is a great binging app to watch all ur fav shows. But lately I’ve been noticing that they’ve been taking off many anime’s. For example, Ouran High School Host Club. Ouran High School Host Club is a popular anime. Many anime watchers are extremely disappointed about Netflix taking it off. But it doesn’t stop there. Netflix is also taking off Hunter x Hunter and Jojos Bizarre Adventure. This is very disappointing to the anime community. Netflix has also in the past taken off Attack on Titan. I’m sure many watchers (like me) are not happy with this. Many people have stated there opinions on this matter on various social media’s such as TikTok. If Netflix keeps taking off anime’s and good shows then I will honestly cancel my subscription.

title: Incorrect PIN
review: If I only watched Netflix on my iPad, I would cancel my subscription immediately because the app is unusable when using a PIN.  As soon as I open the app, it asks for my PIN (prior to selecting a profile) and despite entering the correct PIN, it tells me it is wrong and prompts me again indefinitely.  If I choose the option indicating that I’ve forgotten my PIN (I haven’t), I am taken to the Netflix Web site in my browser.  After I sign into the Web site, I see the exact PIN that I’m entering in the app and that the app is telling me is incorrect.  I even completely uninstalled and reinstalled the app and as soon as I sign in using my email address and password, I am prompted for my PIN and can get no further.  Your market cap is how many BILLIONS and you can’t get even this correct?  What a joke.

title: Netflix please READ!!!
review: Hey, the only complaint I have is the “play next episode” option won’t automatically work unless you are on WiFi. I can understand that you guys may have done this to prevent someone from using up all of their cellular data in case they fall asleep or something, but why can’t we just have the option to turn it on/off while on cellular data? I ditched my WiFi and have unlimited cellular data and I’m super annoyed that next episodes won’t automatically play for me. Lots of times I am cleaning up or watching while I do something else and I have to drop what I’m doing to press the “next episode” button. I hate it!!! Please fix this!!!!!

title: Amazing app - a few details needed to discuss
review:
So for starters, this app is amazing! I use it everyday and it’s pretty easy to understand and use. Recently I’ve been having issues with downloads, I download an episode to watch offline and then once I’m offline and have no WiFi I go to play the episode and it says theirs an error. I’ve updated the app, re-downloaded episodes, and even deleted and re downloaded the app. Nothing seems to work and I can’t watch anything offline. 

That’s been my only issue so far! I hope you can fix it soon.

title: I LOVE this life changing app but there is a popular suggestion that will help Netflix indefinitely!
review: I Absolutely cannot stop watching the trending app Netflix. As a Netflix fan since this pandemic I am proud to say that I have a popular suggestion that I think that should be added to Netflix and will help during this pandemic. As you know the #1 animation seller “Rebecca Sugar’s: Steven Universe”, An UNBELIEVABLE amount of Companies wanted to work with Rebecca’s work since then. Now she came out with “Rebecca Sugar’s: Steven Universe Future THE MOVIE”, An UNFORGETTABLE and Popular Movie in 2019!
