title: U CANNOT TAKE F•R•I•E•N•D•S
review: Look Netflix you been their for me for a long time and we’re pretty Gucci and all but we gonna be the opposite of Gucci when you take FRIENDS off of Netflix because that’s my main right there me and that show have been through a lot and when you don’t come out with the shows I want I know who I can go to and you know who that is, that’s right it’s FRIENDS but you can’t do me like this I’m a good binge watcher and I would also like to complain about the fact the the new season of On My Block has not come out yet

title: Still not enough
review:
The app is very smooth, but still the content is not enough specially in Middle East region we pay the same amount of money as us users but still they have way more movies and series than Middle East region. Moreover, I’m a regular streamer on series like The walking dead and Homeland but you have the only seasons that has ended and I need to wait until the season ends to watch it! For me I might cancel my subscription just one month after subscribing because I can’t find anything to watch. 
“Netflix series are not my type nor their movies”

title: Unhappy
review: I have a big family, and we all watch netflix. Ever since the update, i keep getting kicked off because they only allow two people to use netflix at once. This was an awful idea. Do you know how annoying it is to be watching netflix and then a screen pops up saying “Too many people are on netflix”, even though i was the first one on. This is also annoying because you have to pay more to allow four people to be on at once, and i don’t pay the netflix bill, and we are already paying. It’s also annoying because we have been using netflix for a very long time, and this is the first time i’ve ever considered not using it.

title: Missing seasons makes me see red!!
review: I get so frustrated when Netflix adds 1 season of a series but not the other 2-8 seasons and I don’t mean a recent series but rather series made from 1990’s to 2010 so the entire  # of seasons were already released. The most recent  series I got fooled about was “Magnificent Century” which has 5 seasons but you only offer season 1 which was released in 2005. Since 2005 (that’s 13 years since first season)so all the seasons should be available. Since each season leaves with a cliffhanger that needs the next season to answer I am left hanging! If I knew there weren’t going to be other seasons to tell the whole story I wouldn’t have  watched the first season. Please don’t put just one season on and leave the others missing!

title: Idea!
review: I absolutely love Netflix! I just had one idea that I think would really be beneficial. I think that on the Netflix mobile app it should leave you signed in to the account that you constantly use on that device so I don’t constantly have to click on the account and instead just go straight to the awesome movies. But if you wanted to change the account, it should still have an option for that, but I think it should leave you signed in for easier access. Love you Netflix!!!

title: I am frustrated
review: I was given a kids account and I recently found out that you can’t change the parental settings and can only watch PG or G rated movies and shows please fix that I am 13 years old and my parents allow me to watch any PG13 movies and shows on their account but I am tired of that. Fix it please. (Of there is any way to fix it please comment on this) but other than that and the fact that I usually have to wait s year or two for something I want to come out on Netflix even after it has aired on TV and that show series ended or the movie is out o theaters it is ok. Maybe add a teen account or something.

title: Too liberal and not enough good shows.
review:
I like some of Netflix’s available shows: Trollhunters, Spirit: Riding Free, Miraculous, etc. Mostly family shows, but Netflix is inundated with crappy shows and movies that make even scrolling through the available options undesirable. Too many horror movies, homosexual movies and shows, liberal propaganda options, and inappropriate movies and shows.

To top it off, now they’ve given former president Obama and his spouse a retainer, contract, whatever you want to call it. That is the final straw. My family will not pay Netflix to pay people like the Obamas. We will be cancelling our subscription before we are charged again next month. Fire the Obamas and we will come back, but until then no entertainment is worth that.

title: Going downhill
review: So Netflix was always the place to go when you want to watch a movie with the family.... in 2010 I just feel like each year it has more crash’s and less good shows. Netflix you are the place to go. And now I can’t watch some of my favorite shows because it crashes every time. Please I want to see the good old Netflix again I mean Netflix is amazing. But I just think it is going downhill. Make Netflix great again. 😆 so if you want Netflix build a time machine go back to 2010 and you can get some good shows. Hope you guys read this so you can do a good update that doesn’t crash thanks for reading

title: FIX YOUR APP AND WEBSITE LAYOUT SO UNPROFESSIONAL
review: Isn’t Netflix suppose to play the next show after another? Next episodes in 10 seconds? NO, I have to keep going back to the menu and pressing play. Because of that little disgusting error and Netflix not showing all the episodes available for  the season (NO SLIDER, OR CAPTION HELPER SAYING THAT THERES MORE EPISODES IF YOU CLICK THIS BUTTON TO EXPAND WHICH I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO DO...THAT DOESN'T LOOK LIKE A BUTTON TO SHOW MORE SHOWS BUT IS POINTING DIRECTLY DOWN AT THE RECOMMENDED SHOWS ) How would I have known to literally click a button that looks like it’s pointing down to the RECOMMENDATIONS for shows and not a button down to see the rest of episodes for the season? BECAUSE OF YOUR UNPROFESSIONAL WEBSITE SET UP, I MISSED THE LAST 2 EPISODES OF MY SHOW, AND I ALREADY WENT TO WATCH SEASON 2. I HATE YOU NETFLIX. YOU ARE NOT WORTH IT.

title: Where’s sixteen candles????!!!!!??!?
review:
I’m thoroughly disappointed in you Netflix. Sixteen candles was my favorite movie ever and they took it off Netflix. What kind of sick being did this? I want to talk to your manager Netflix. Also you took off pretty in pink? They were the only movies I watched on here. Will be uninstalling. Do not recommend you download. 

(This is a joke but seriously Netflix I’m disappointed you took them off I loved those movies.) 
 
Also it’s so hard to find something to watch. Like I feel like there’s not that many things to choose from but there kinda is.

title: MY REVIEW
review: Absolutely love Netflix, I wish there was more of a selection of movies. I was wondering if I can recommend adding a spot for Netflix users to leave a review in their opinion of a show/movie. I request this because I’ve come across several movies and shows I’m unfamiliar with and would love to get peoples opinions before I decide to waste my time 30 minutes in something I don’t like. Thanks Netflix and keep the new stuff (along with older movies such as nightmare before Christmas etc) coming out as well.

title: I need more
review: I love Netflix it is a awesome streaming sight but I would like to see more Marvel movies I really love all of them and it is a lot of money to buy them all separate for my family and then them be messed up. And my kids love how to train your dragon and avatar the last air bender and I know they are coming out with a live action avatar they are not adding how to train your dragon and I would love to see that. Other then the lack of main kids movies and superhero movies I love Netflix and use it all the time 9/10 recommend to people with out kids who will not stop bugging you

title: Love it, but.
review: The only issue is that I pay monthly so I should be able to download an epsilon’s more than once! I fall asleep (mostly everyone) often watching my shows and then they expire and I can’t download them. I live in an area where I get no cell service and I don’t have WiFi. So this is the thing that saves my life now I have to skip ahead to give me something to download. I wish you guys would just up your yearly download limit for videos to 5 downloads or 10 maybe something higher than the 2-3 you guys give. Thank you, next! 👌🏼😊

title: ughh
review: for the past day now it has been not letting me go onto netflix. it has worked for everyone else (on the same account) but me. it says there is a problems connecting to netflix every time i try to use it for the past week. i’ve tried everything, shutting down my phone, deleting the app and reinstalling it, nothing works. on my computer it also says there is a problem connecting to it, and it also says that my free trial is almost done. which would make sense but i’ve had my netflix account for maybe about 4-5 years. my family did change the password when this happen because someone who wasn’t us was on it, however i did use the new password and it wouldn’t work. i then deleted it and reinstalled it and it won’t even let me sign in, just saying it “can’t connect” and when i say retry it never actually loads. other than that love netflix however does need to add more shows instead of random, bad reviewed shows and movies.

title: Good but
review: I love Netflix but I share an account and I have my own profile but my other family keeps going on and watching kid shows with their kids and it’s getting on my last nerve is there a way you can add a feature and lock it and you can open it with a password? That’s the only thing I have issues with but im just giving a suggestion about it and I want to be able to delete history so I can get them off my thing thanks I hope you take this into consideration

title: Nice... I guess!
review: Netflix is a good app, right? Yeah, that’s what I thought most people like Netflix. Anyway there are some things I don’t like, so I was watching this show, and it said that it wasn’t showing on Netflix anymore. I was like, what? So if you watch Netflix, don’t get to attached to the show, or movie you’re watching. But yeah, other then that, Netflix is amazing. I give it one star less only because of the fact that when I watch something it just goes away. Also anybody, do NOT watch Santa Clarita Diet. My daughter watched it, and so did I. It’s not that... great. Bye! You’re welcome for the Review! ;)

title: Why Netflix is so awesome
review: Netflix has really outdone themselves. I honestly love Netflix because you can watch on your TV, your phone,  your tablet etc. And I really like the good movies and shows and different genres they have. They have everything you want scary, funny and I really like the good movies and shows and different genres they have. They have everything you want scary, Comedy, romantic, and just basically anything. I love Netflix because it’s so nice to have new shows and really good movies and I really appreciate Netflix.

title: Netflix VR Compatibility.
review: Thank you Netflix Developers for bringing such an outstanding app. I have been using Netflix for years and would not trade my subscription to any other video or movie apps. But with recent development of Virtual Reality headsets, I think viewers should be able to watch movies in a VR state. That would be a great feature, but I don’t speak for the rest of the users. I hope someone takes the time to read my review and consider. You have me sold all the way to the end. Thanks for bringing such a great app.

title: Logging In Doesn’t Work
review: I’ve been using the app for a while now. It’s more convenient using the app since I bring my phone everywhere. The problem is, however, is that the app refuses to let me log in anymore. I’ve tried changing my password, contacting support, looking up ways to fix the problem, checking my network, and updating the app, yet it still refuses to log in. I thought maybe it was a problem for others too, so I took a break from using it for a while. Weeks later, it still refuses to let me log in. I don’t know what else to do now, I’ve tried everything recommended by others online and on Netflix Support, yet nothing has worked.

title: Close to perfection
review:
Thanks Netflix! This is a quick review of this app, not of Netflix itself. 
Love
1. I watched three entire tv shows at sd definition and only used 3.5 Gb! As someone who only has cellular data, i thank you. Doing that at low quality on Hbo Go uses like 14 Gb! 
2. Price per month is excellent. 
3. Reasonable selection of movies, although I believe there is not enough blockbusters, though that would likely be very expensive. 
Dislike.
1. Why aren’t all shows and movies downloadable? Maybe there is a reasonable answer to this, but it is not cool. I took time writing this review, please read it. 
2. OK so half the time my cellular data doesn’t work for some dumb reason but that is not your fault. So what I like to do is download movies but then for some reason when I plug them into my TV through lightning cable my phone then says playing on TV but the television just shows a black screen although I hear the sound. Please fix!!!

title: CRASHING
review: Netflix is a good app. That is, t used to be a good app. Today, I tried to open it and it just gave me the loading symbol for a few seconds before it crashed. I did this a few times with the same result. Ok, I checked which apps were running in the background, and there were a lot. Fair enough, maybe that's why it was crashing. I closed all those apps and opened Netflix again, only to get the same result. Ok, I changed to cellular data. Still crashing. I refreshed the Netflix app. Still crashing. This has never happened to me before; what is it and when will it be fixed? Until it's fixed, it's unusable. 2 stars because at the very least, it USED to be good.

Dont get me wrong, I love Netflix. I’ve used it for a while and its got me out of boredom most of the time. But the thing that I don’t really like about it, is the sections. Theres kids and adult. You think that the kids section would have shows like tweens watch, but they dont. I dont think tweens and teens would watch nursery rhymes or toddler shows. And for adults, tweens and teens shouldn’t even be watching all the adult stuff! Shows like, “Alexa and Katie” and, “Greenhouse Academy” should be on the list. So I hope you see this, Netflix, because its coming from an actual tween.
title: More Tween And Teen Sections!

review: Netflix is. WONDERFUL app and there’s free movies there and these is a kid section and a parents one of the dislikes is that maybe they should keep some movies that are old like i wanted to see a lot of movies that are old but these was a couple not a lot but anyway this app is wonderful i am giving 5 stars thank you whoever made Netflix making it free not like other games that want you too download it for the money and then the movies are not free anyway have a wonderful day and weekend bye
title: Wonderful app one of the best ones

review: I’ve been a Netflix customer for almost five years. I’m not someone who goes out of my way to write a complaint but I can’t begin to express my recent frustration with Netflix. They tend to rotate older movies and shows with newer media. As much as I like the availability of popular new movies and shows, I am extremely frustrated with what they have chosen to replace. I know many people who are beyond upset about the recent removal of classic shows such as Friends and Gossip Girl. I can guarantee that these shows have much more customer activity than some of these new, junky “Netflix Originals”. Don’t bother wasting your time subscribing to this app just to get attached to something that will be ripped away from you.
title: Extremely Disappointed

review: Netflix is a great app! I just feel like you should be able to delete things from your continue watching. Bc it’s really annoying how I start watching something, don’t like it, and then it sits in my continue watching for a few months and then just goes away. I want to be able to get rid of it sooner. Also, I think you should be able to go to a section called “genres” and there should be like documentaries, sci-fi, fantasy, etc. Thank you and have a great day!
title: Great app! But.....

review: this app is really good!! i love it a lot, but there should be a few things changed. for example, when you screenrecord a part of a movie or show on netflix it is a black screen when saved to your camera roll. this should be changed because people (like me) on instagram have editing accounts and like to make edits of shows/people we like and we want to get clips off of shows that can be streamed on netflix. but it doesn’t let us do that when there is a black screen. also like many of us while we are traveling/in the car, people like to watch movies, but if your traveling to let’s say ax to california, you have to go through places without service, or places with service just not wifi. and it’s very inconvenient having to download the movies you want to watch while traveling. so netflix should be allowed to stream without wifi, and service.
title: really good, but a couple flaws.

review: Netflix is great!! I love how Netflix has been coming out with lots of new shows that are Netflix Originals. I ESPECIALLY enjoy Stranger Things. It brings sadness, love, anger, comedy, suspense, and happiness all together. Stranger Things 3 was by far the best season!!!! There are a few things Netflix should work on. I feel like they should add movies and shows from an older time, because lots of people look for movies like that, and always seem to have to buy them or rent them somewhere else. They should also add a better variety of romance and horror movies, other than that, Netflix is great!
title: Netflix

review: Look, I love Netflix. The only reason I’m giving it 3 stars is because of how slowly you put more seasons to a show. I’m currently watching the series “Black Butler” and I’m still waiting on season two. I’ve been doing some research and found out that show has been on Netflix for a long time now and used to actually have season two. People mostly think Netflix has removed Black Butler 2 or the whole entire series just because Netflix hasn’t renewed it's license for the show. So if that’s the actual reason you don’t give viewers the next episode or season to their favorite show, please renew your license.
title: Renew your license

review:
I love Netflix but I’m super confused lately 
I was traveling for the two weeks which I don’t think would have anything to do with this I hope but when I was in London it showed that I could watch this new weekly episodes of Jane the virgin which was season 5 but now it’s completely disappeared. And then I saw all 3 of the hangover movies but now that’s gone then when I was in Spain I was watching season 2 of good girls and now it isn’t there. And thennnn I was super upset because I also watched and added to my list all the Harry Potter movies but there gone now soooo what is this ?
title: Umm what ?

review:
Since the last update the app fails to load after starting. It is not a connectivity error. It is just this app. It stays on a black and gray screen just loading for too long. It deters me from even trying to open the app at this point.

Edit: it’s the home screen. The home screen will not load and just keeps transitioning between a black screen with the bottom menu bar. The buttons on the bar load and work just fine. Please fix my home screen. This is not a new error. It started with the last iOS update.
title: Iphonex

review: Ok so besides the little buffer even when I’m on WiFi, I’m more so disturbed by the removal of really iconic shows. I realize its to make room for new shows but I frequently like binge watching shows from my childhood and their disappearing and I’m down about that. I know it was a while ago but I still miss avatar and mean girls etc. If they made room for new shows but still had room for those oldie’s but goodies a lot of their reviews would improve and they’d stop losing customers who have been watching and using Netflix for years. Corporate please look at the vast number or people complaining about this, and geez , come on, were paying more with the new cost for some junky “modern” shows replacing the shows we know and love!
title: Vanishing shows

review: I don’t really watch Netflix on my phone but i think now was the perfect time to start because in a couple of weeks i will be going on a plane trip and i can’t take my chrome book and my tv on the plane sadly but i can take my phone and it will be great because i can watch all of my tv shows because of the download shows thing you added. I can easily just watch my shows at night without my mom and dad realizing that my tv or chrome book is on!!!
title: Netflix is so GREAT

review: If you primarily watch on a PC or via the app, you can't get an HD or 4K stream. Different browsers have different limits but even that seems to not work. 720p on Chrome?! That's outrageous. Edge apparently allows better quality and that used to work but no longer, it seems. For the amount of resources this company has, it's simply unacceptable to take money in exchange for this shoddy service. Yes, I pay extra for the upgraded quality. I'm a professional video editor and have an excellent workstation with a large 4K monitor. Yet this state of the art company only delivers junk quality like it's 2003. I might as use RealPlayer. Often it will simply not work— "Whoops, something went wrong!" No thanks. Use an alternative.
title: More like Cataract Simulator — No HD/4K on PC (spotty at best)

review: I always make sure that the app is up to date to ensure that I won’t have any difficulties connecting to my tv or have problems when I simply want to watch a show or movie but there’s always a problem when I try to connect my phone to my tv. Both devices are connected to the same WiFi and it mainly never works. When it’s trying to connect, sometimes it either completely close out the app on my tv back to the regular channels or it freezes up my whole tv to the point where my own remote will not be able to power it off unless I unplug it and that does start to get frustrating after a while.
title: Problems Connecting to my Tv

review: I tried to say it does not let you sign up so I’ll write a 1 to 3 or four not a five because it won’t let me sign up but it would let you sign in so that’s kind of confusing but I managed to try going to other apps tell you do music and watch movies and stuff but I would not get Netflix so yeah people in my neighborhood and never use Netflix they’ll use Roku channels and other things like that because I don’t trust Netflix they won’t let you sign up at all and it’s kind of boring I’ve been sitting here for an hour and I tried to set it up but selling the people that I call they tell me to convey their website I did and it will you sign up so yay for me 👎👎👎👎👎 Netflix is one of the worst things in the world can’t even sign up
title: Netflix

review: I love Netflix. It has all the movies and tv shows I love to watch, but lately I have noticed some glitches that haven’t been happening before. My audio will stay on but the screen will freeze up. I have to exit the app and come back, but then 5 minutes later I have to do it again. I know it’s not just my phone, my computer does the same thing as well. If this glitch is fixed it would be 5 stars but for now I would probably have to give it 3 stars.
title: Glitches

review: I love Netflix. There are a variety of different options and it’s very beneficial being able to download movies / shows and being able to watch it when your on the plane or don’t have wifi. However, the limit is around 10 downloads. Update that! Who cares how many downloads there are. I can only download 2 shows because the rest of my family always has a competition on who can get the most downloaded before a long trip. Overall, it’s a very great app and I’m happy to be part of this opportunity.
title: Downloading

review: This is really great app, especially since I don’t have cable so I can still watch T.V shows with this. The thing is though, I really wanted to watch an anime called Sword Art Online. My friends said it was on here but when I searched it it wasn’t there. It came up with other Anime and some weird looking shows, but not what I searched. I told my friend about it and sent a picture of the results, she sent a picture of her results and hers had the anime l. I’m a little confused why this is happening but yeah, other than that it’s a great app.
title: Search Results

review: I have 20/90 vision in my best eye, WITH corrective lenses. I can’t read half the titles on Netflix due to the chosen font or certain colors in the background. We really need an option to display the title either under or over the image tiles so we can actually read them. The native screen reader skips over all of the titles because it only sees them as images. This option would not only allow for low vision people to read every title, but also give those watching in not-the-best-coverage to actually know what the titles are without waiting two full minutes of staring at a screen with blank tiles in hopes that one of them grabs their interest.
title: Desperate Need Of Accessibility

review: I have movies downloaded and have full internet service however for the past two days I am a unable to go more than a few minutes before the movie flickers and goes back tot he main menu and then keep flickering. I updated the app hoping that it would work and nothing, also tried resetting my phone iOS and nothing. Not sure what is going on but service is not working as it used to. Very disappointed as I am paying for a higher fee and unable to make use of the application as I would like to. (And I am using download movies).
title: Unable to watch- flickering and shutting down

review:
Seriously one of the most frustrating apps I’ve ever used. Has trouble connecting with chromecast and staying connected while I’m watching a show. Once it is connected and playing, I have to restart the app when I leave it or the screen turns off (literally every time) if I want to pause/change the show. Plus, it’s terrible for finding new shows/movies. Almost every single category is just a repeat of the same “new” shows. And instead of fixing functionality every new update seems to add some dumb feature that no one really needs. 

Overall really disappointing considering how much money Netflix has. You’d think they’d put some amount of effort something this important.
title: Doesn’t work for Chromecast

review: I LOVE this app.  Been using it for years and has a great selection of movies and TV shows.  My one suggestion is to bring back the star rating or give a middle option  on your current rating.   The thumbs up/thumbs down rating stinks.  It’s too limited and if I liked a movie but didn’t think it was fantastic then I don’t rate it which is then hard to keep track of what I watched.  Plus...... when you moved away from the star rating, it removed ALL movies I rated in the past, so now I don’t know what I watched previously.  Pretty annoying.
title: One minor adjustment

review: This app works great as expected. No bugs that ive been able to find. However, i would like to add improvements to the app that would allow you to double tap the screen to pause the movie/show and double tap screen to resume play. Additionally, a way to delete continue watching shows instead of me having to log onto my account and removing each manually :) other than that I’ll keep paying for the subscription
title: Works great but suggest improvements

review: The new Barbie series just does not feel right. I like the old Barbie series when she was a doll. In the old series, she had many of the sets I have, including the Skipper, Stacie, and Chelsea dolls, and the Barbie jet. That is why I am disappointed that there are not many episodes of it. Also, many of the cooking shows are rated ma or pg 13 just because of bad language. Could Netflix just tune out the words? In conclusion, I really enjoy Netflix, and so does my whole family. These are just some suggestions.
title: Like it overall, but here are some things about shows...

review: I love this app, at least I DID. now I only rate 3 stars. Because of Netflix deleting seasons and saying for you to PAY for them, I think. I don't know if you fixed it, but if you didn't, get to it. Anyways, I was going to watch my favorite episode which is in season 3. I hop onto Netflix, so see, "where is seasons 1-6?" No where. Frustrated, I close out, turn off my iPad, and slam it on my bed. Next to my iPad I flop onto my bed. I groan. Please get to fixing this, along with the bugs. Thank you! (I get if this is for money, btw. But I just can't buy these seasons if you have to pay for them, so I complain)
title: I don't like this 7-10 seasons of Futurama.

review: This app is one of my favorites, my family and I have been committed customers and have enjoyed it for years, but recently the app has failed to open even prior to the update, I don’t know if it’s my I pod touch or the app, I’ve tried restarting my iPod and making sure I had a good amount of storage, I have a good WiFi Connection, I was wondering if there has been multiple complaints about it failing to start, I hope this will help you guys in future updates!

title: Bring back shows

review:
the show I am not okay with this and many other LGBTQ inclusive shows have been canceled to make a Kissing Booth 3. there are a few things wrong with this. number one, I am not okay with this ended on a huge cliffhanger, so we will never get to know what happens. second, no one wants a Kissing Booth 3. but then again, no one wanted a kissing booth 1. lastly, by canceling so many great LGBTQ shows for a another movie that has no LGBTQ representation, is saying that Netflix doesn't want LGBTQ representation. even if that's not what Netflix meant by that, it's still sending the wrong message. let's face it, Netflix is blatantly saying they're homophobic, and that's not good for business, is it?

be better
title: Netflix is homophobic

review: If you plan to buy Netflix, be really really sure that this is what you want. Netflix only has a 3.8 review because of shows or movies that some how are not available in the U.S but in other countries? We are paying Netflix over 25$ or more to ensure that our entertainment is truly satisfied. How can you allow other people to watch almost every show in Netflix but don’t allow people in the U.S the same rights? Netflix I only got one thing to say to you, you either fix that problem by lowering the prices due to only few shows or movies shown in the U.S...or you can just keep losing customers, because after I’m done with my 1 month membership, I will stop using Netflix until it’s fixed.

title: Pretty good

review:
I watch shows at my friend’s house often, typically binge-watching a season at a time. She comes over to my house sometimes and we watch it at my place, too. I don’t appreciate that when I click the button to change seasons on a show, it changes back. 

Like, for example, say I was at the end of S1 on my account, then I watched the entirety of S2 at my friends house, then went to pick it back up at S3 next time. Everytime I click to season 3, it defaults back to season 1 or 2. It’s inconvenient and really stupid. Can you just fix that, because it’s so aggravating to keep changing the season.
title: Changing Seasons

review: I binge watch shows and movies all the time. I love the app- it has many great Netflix originals and many other movies from when I was a child or even movies that came out. I love the shows on there and love that Netflix keeps adding more seasons and even more series from cable networks. I recommend putting the TV series ‘Castle’. I seriously love that show and I’m sure your app would get more viewers since it doesn’t air on TV anymore. Many other recommendations but the TV shows on there are awesome.
title: Amazing App

review:
The app doesn’t work nearly as well as other video apps. Movies often fail to download, stop and won’t resume or need multiple tries.  It should resume or re-try automatically. Prime video works flawlessly.

Needs better touch controls.  Check out infuse. Up/down on the left side of the screen adjusts brightness, up/down on the right side adjusts volume and swiping left/right does high speed forward/reverse to let you quickly skip parts or re-watch parts while being able to scrub to the exact spot you want.  A big company like Netflix should have these types of controls in their app if a little mom and pop app like infuse has them.
title: So-so

review:
I just wish there was a way to filter out shows and movies with certain ratings. Maybe I’m being stupid and there is a way to do that, but I haven’t seen one within the app. 
Basically, I am not allowed to watch anything rated R or TV-MA, and for good reason (I am definitely too young). I would like to be able to take those off of my Netflix app so that I find more shows and movies with more appropriate ratings for me. 
If there is actually a way to do this, someone let me know! I will definitely give Netflix a 5-star rating if I can do that.

title: Love it but...

review:
And you wonder why there’s been a lot of people unsubscribing lately. Many movies have been purged/sent to other streaming services while Netflix creates more and more original stuff. Not going to lie, there have been greats, such as with Stranger Things and Lucifer, but Sturgeon’s Law is in effect here: most of it’s garbage, lest it be strange foreign films, creepy CGI childrens’ nursery rhymes, or SJW nonsense. It’s even been to the point that people have been making memes about this stuff (Anime -> Manga -> Netflix Original)!
And you WONDER why more and more people are subscribing to services such as Disney+, which not only have a reasonable price, but also a large library of quality content ALL old, new, and created specifically for the service.

review: The new black mirror interactive movie has made Netflix a whole new experience. title: Bandersnatch

review:
First off, since the new update, the setup is horrible. There is no go back fifteen seconds button, the exit button is on the opposite side, and the pause/play button is in the middle. I don’t enjoy this at all. 

Almost none of the Netflix originals are worth watching. There is nothing to watch anymore. All the good food network shows are gone. All the shoes I watched on repeat years ago are gone. All the cartoons my younger siblings watched over and over on Netflix are now gone. 

Netflix is great overall. But over the past few years, it’s been changing, and not for the better.
title: Many problems

review:
Dear Netflix creators, 

I’ve noticed that you all have decided to remove F.R.I.E.N.D.S from the Netflix connection. BIG MISTAKE. I don’t think you all understand the power of that show for this generation. That show shows the importance of support, friendship, how to have fun without drugs, phones, or other daily tech we have provided to us today. That show has the power to completely reshape our generation. Please, please do not remove F.R.I.E.N.D.S. Personally, that show has shaped the 16 year old self I am today. It has taught me the fun you can have just by interacting with other people, the ability to speak up and just learn to live life through the smallest problems that could feel so huge. It’s made me realize that I’m a Monica, and the people I rely on in life are my Joeys, Rosses, Rachels, and Chandlers. Please don’t take the opportunity away that this show has to support the people who need it. I have lists of episodes to watch win every emotion I come by. That’s how strong it is. I beg of you all, with thousands of people with me, do not remove the most powerful show we have left.

Thank you,

Ahava Atar
title: DO NOT REMOVE F.R.I.E.N.D.S

review:
This review is only about the app, not the service. Most people know Netflix by now.

When they updated the app about 6 mos ago, they removed the information section of the movie or tv show.  Now, when you tap on what you want to watch, you only see a few tags but no description.  The description is critical, however, when you are searching for new movies/shows to watch.  The descriptive info is present on TV apps (like Smart TVs).  So, it still exists, but has been removed from iPhone/iPad apps.  Netflix, please restore a descriptive information box or tab.  Its removal hampers using Netflix to search for what you want to watch.
title: What happened to movie/show info??
This is an amazing app but a few things...
review: I would just like to say this is an amazing app and you should definitely get it but just a few recommendations I think than you should add a Flash icon that you can be, I love the flash and I would like it to be my icon, second the downloads take way to long, I go on a trip to Florida every year and I watch movies in the car and when we’re about to leave I download movies to watch in the car but they always take forever to load and we are suddenly rushing like we should not be.

title: Subtitles are wrong
review: I personally enjoy Netflix a lot and its wide selection of movies and shows, but recently I have been using Netflix to learn a new language too. I have started to watch cartoon shows in French with French subtitles, and I have realized that the subtitles often aren’t the same as the words being spoken. The overall meaning is the same, but the words are different, which makes it harder for me to know what is going on. I tried to see if this only happened in that one show, but I found that in many shows or movies the subtitles are wrong even in English. I think this is something Netflix should consider fixing for many people rely on subtitles to know what is going on in a movie or show. Thank you.

title: It’s great...
review: Great service with a good selection of shows and movies, having said that there’s also a lot of uninteresting stuff used as filler....a lot. There’s not much in the way of blockbusters and the one that are there really didn’t make much of an impact. One thing that needs improvement is the search and categories, you spend more time searching for something to watch than actually watching anything. Once you’ve found something though it’s smooth sailing.

title: Removing Too Many Animes
review: This was the first app I ever used to watch anime on, and I'm really disappointed to see Hunter x Hunter, Attack On Titan, Ouran High School Host Club, and many other animes go. This was the very first app I had ever used to watch anime on (2014), so if more animes go away, I might shift to some other app. Other than the anime problem, I have also been seeing other shows that I have watched disappear. Seeing all of this happen really disappoints me, so I might cancel all of my subscriptions (separately) that I have. On a positive note, there is still many available shows for different interests, but many of them does not seem enjoyable nor interesting to me and my siblings.

title: The app is great, but...
review: I love Netflix like most people. Has a great selection of TV shows and movies and this past year you guys have outdone yourself with the original content. My only complaint is that I watch Netflix from my phone A LOT. and I hook my phone up to my TV so that I can watch with family/friends. I find it annoying that I have to press the next button to get to the next episode every time an episode ends. Is there any way you guys could make it so that it plays the next episode on it’s own as it does from your laptop?

title: More Options Needed
review: I like watching shows and movies on Netflix daily, especially the ones I am interested in. I dislike it how I have to watch an entire series or movie for it to be removed off my continue watching list. There are some shows I have lost interest in and would like to remove my continue watching list, but I can’t because I have no option to. I would if Netflix were to add the option to remove a show or movie off the continue watching list if someone has lost interest in, just like me.

title: Just one issue
review: This is one of my two main forms of video entertainment, which I use pretty equally. I love Netflix originals. I love the inclusivity that their writing team brings. What I don't love is my sister logging into my account and starting movies and shows that I'd never watch and then I CANNOT remove them from "continue watching." I looked it up, and all instructions say to tap "account" under "more." These articles written just last November are void since "account" is nowhere to be seen since recent updates. Why take that away? Please bring it back or make it simpler to remove accidental watching. Please??

title: It’s good but it could do better.
review: I like Netflix for watching some of my favorite shows and movies, I think the app has become better ever since they added audio description for the blind or low vision. But I feel it’s a little limited as it’s only on Netflix originals. Even though some don’t have it at all or it’s only available on the shows original language, in my opinion it would be better if all of Netflix’s shows and movies had audio description and in other languages, that way a blind person or low vision is able to enjoy the same content as a sighted person

title: Needs An Update ASAP
review: Dear Netflix, I hope you read this. I have watched so many series on this app. It is amazing! I like how you can download episodes to watch them when you are offline! I also like that you can add things to your list and rate them. HOWEVER, I am VERY disappointed that the best Netflix Original series only have one season. ALSO, there are other series such as RIVERDALE that do not have a season 2 added on Netflix. There is a season 2 Riverdale out there, but it has not yet been added to Netflix. PLEASE, PLEASE ADD RIVERDALE SEASON 2 TO NETFLIX, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE. THAT IS THE ONLY REASON I GAVE 4 STARS INSTEAD OF 5. THANK YOU.

title: APP NOT WORKING50
review: Netflix APP for IPAD is down and Netflix customer service takes 90 minutes and three different representatives to state that they don’t know when it will be fixed, can not offer a credit for the time it is down, and that their recommendation is that their customers cancel their service until the issue is resolved.  Being told to use another device when IPAD is the device that is preferred is bizarre customer service to say the least.  When requesting that Netflix send an alert to their customers that they are experiencing an issue with their app, their response is they have too many customers to be able to send out that notification.  Unbelievable.  #notcoolnetflix

title: Couple of Wishes on an Update
review:
Some of us are choosy about what we or our families watch and knowing the MPAA rating is helpful. When looking unsuccessfully for a rating it would be nice to know if I just haven’t found the rating or if it is unrated.

The other thing about the old star system (instead of thumbs up/down) is by leaving a rating I could tell if I had already seen a movie.

Please don’t label foreign productions as “international” and expect me to infer they will be speaking Hindi or Turkish. Tell me, maybe on the screen with “Details” — you know, where the ratings are — that the dialogue is Turkish but English subtitles are available.

title: Great app just needs some kid friendly update
review:
We love Netflix it’s constantly updating programs and movies we have been using it for 4 years.
One thing that would make it a 5 star would be to have it filter movies and shows per rating like for my kids I only like them to watch Y programs and shows and that's all but even when  I have set their profiles for young kids it still shows PG and G movies and shows which I don’t like for my kids to watch. 
Please make it easier for parents to filter what we want our kids to watch

title: One major complaint
review:
Usually I give games and apps five stars even if they have a few bugs or annoying things, because the developers worked hard on it, although this isn’t a bug and I’m pretty sure it’s been looked over. Recently, the subtitles have disappeared in some of the things that I’ve been watching. Countless times in Quantico, and quite a few in the 2 hour movie Enola Holmes.
Typically this wouldn’t prompt me to give the app 4 stars because I like almost everything else, but it happens way too much.

title: It could be better
review: I terms of a streaming service Netflix is fine. Small features or improvements can still be made that other streaming services have. If I could queue episodes or movies instead of having to open the app to change content. Gives me more of a marathon vibe. Another would be improved rating/feedback on content. I would like to see what others say and rate the content. Most importantly though, create an option to customize the time/frequency of the dreaded “Are You Still Watching” prompt. It’s 2021 and yes I’m still here trying to binge watch.

title: Best Shows!!
review: Netflix is where I go to watch my favorite shows and movies. Netflix has a variety of different shows and movies. I love Netflix, it’s one of my favorite apps! Although I did rate this app 5 stars, I have one concern. I was reading through a couple reviews and I came across one that caught my eye. She said that she thought there should be a section for teens and I agree. Kids watch cartoons, adults watch boring things. I think it would be kinda cool if Netflix added a teen section.

title: Netflix isn’t workinggg
review: Hey, Five star review because there’s great shows and have never had a problem! But the past few days my netflix just netflix has been acting up. I’m not sure why and it’s very annoying! I’ll go to watch a show and it will take a million hours to load and then when the people are talking there mouths move before the words come out and that’s for every tv show and movie i’ve put multiple on and they all have it! Please help anyone!

title: Subs not appearing and not all seasons
review: So I watch a lot of anime on this app and I notice that whenever I watch it on tv, not all the subtitles appear. Fix it please? It’s been like that for ages. Also, why can’t you get all the seasons of a show? Once you buy the rights to a show you can put the whole thing onto your app, right? If so, I don’t think it’s that hard to take someone else’s show and plaster it onto your app, no matter how many seasons. If I pay you ten dollars a month to see a show, I expect to see the whole show. Other than that, it’s good.

title: Why Netflix is better in MEXICO?
review: I went for a vacation to Mexico and i payed Netflix there and it was a lot of cool stuff like teen wolf, the Grim, Avatar the leyend of Ang etc. But now that im back to USA all those shows desapeared and i downloaded teen wolf but i can watch it ever if the episodes are in my downloads  im just tired that Netflix is so repetitive  nothing gets my attention like when i jas on mexico i just dont get why in cant be like that in here  i know these will be ignored but i dont care i want all the good shows that Netflix used to have or i think i will cancel my suscription and i will find a better app to use because now netflix is not worth it. I wish you guys fix these or i will atop using these app and i know a lot of people feel me

title: “My List” never works
review:
I do not understand why they even offer this option because it never updates.  I have stupidly added titles I want to watch later and removed then when I am no longer interested.  Yet, the app never refreshes “My List”.  

My second complaint is that suggestions have become too heavily weighted almost exclusively towards Netflix content for my tastes.  I would like suggestions that favored my own viewing preferences rather than items Netflix is currently pushing.

I’ve been a longtime Netflix subscriber from back when they only mailed you DVDs.  But this year I have begun to question if the cost of their services is justified, and I’ve become inclined to look elsewhere for entertainment.

title: This is a good app, but it needs one change...
review: Don't get me wrong, Netflix is a great app. But recently it started to get buggy. At first, it works out great. I can watch most of the shows that I want to. Then after about two weeks nothing shows up. No shows whatsoever. So I get rid of the app and download it again. Two weeks later the same thing happens. After doing that three or four times it just says it's not compatible. I can't re-download it. so I'm not sure what to do. Please fix this. I'm in the middle of watching sword art online.

title: Always freezing and stopping, giving errors and needing resets
review: Netflix continues to raise its pricing, yet it never works seamlessly.  Paying more and more for a service that isn’t consistent doesn’t make sense. I won’t cancel, since a few of our favorites and daughters favorites are on here but I think about canceling often since it’s such a headache. Why does it always freeze? Why does it have an issue almost every other time loading a show? Why does it not let me log in sometimes? Why don’t our recently watched shows consistently show up in the continued watching?  Put the price back to the lower amount, because this is not quality.

title: Season 2? 3? 4?
review: Netflix is not adding the final seasons of their shows as options for us to watch. I remember finishing the season 2 of a show like Yu-Gi-Oh Arc V , and then finding out that there wasn’t a dubbed season 3! Not even on Crunchyroll! I am thoroughly disappointed at the way Netflix is building us up to let us down. Just like the movie I used to watch, Mean Girls was it? Yah, they removed it literally a few days before my friends and I were waiting to enjoy it together. It’s not like there isn’t already a wide variety of shows on Netflix. But, it’s either you start and END a show, or don’t start it at all. Otherwise, the viewers won’t be satisfied, and it won’t make you look good no matter how many times you try to justify it.

I often watch a lot of shows in different languages on my phones and the plain white default subtitles make it hard to read what it being said. 

I’ve already tried going on the Netflix website (not through the iPhone application itself) to switch the captioning settings to no avail. I update the settings and go back to the app only to find that nothing has changed. 

**I also tried turning my phone off completely and deleting and reinstalling Netflix, doesn’t change anything.

I also went on to changing the captioning settings via the internal iPhone settings (Settings > General > Accessibility > Closed captioning/subtitles) and again it didn’t work. 

But yeah, other than that the app works much to my liking. The app would get a 5/5 from me if it weren’t for those captioning issues.

I’m on the newest version of the iPhone 6s version by the way.
title: Problem with Subtites / CC

review:
Netflix flies under the radar by billing through different platforms be it iTunes, GooglePlay or Netflix or some other platform!  And it can result in you paying for the same account more than once per month! And they will not attempt to make you aware of it!!!  They will allow the double charging to occur as long as it does till you discover it and then will only refund you 3 months!  No, they do not ever claim responsibility for such errors!  They site it as a personal financial responsibility they YOU catch the double billing!!!  ARE YOU SERIOUS???  
Yes!!!  They billed me for over a year using 2 different billing platforms and they REFUSED to fix the problem and refund me!
I WILL NEVER USED NETFLIX AGAIN!
title: Better check your bank statement twice!!

review: Okay I love Netflix and it is my number one used app, but recently I’ve noticed that they are taking a lot of good shows. Like friends. If you end up taking off all of our favorite tv shows and just having Netflix originals, then I’m not going to give you my family’s business. I also think that always having more options is fantastic because lately there has been a drought in good TV shows, and our whole family relies on rewatching good tv shows like friends, while waiting for more episodes of another show to come out.
title: Ummmm why are you taking everything off Netflix

review: I love the Netflix app and it contains really great shows. One thing I would recommend is multiple lists, like my list, where you can add different movies like you would in “My List”. They would be possibly be playlists or technically “Watch” lists and you could title them different things such as “Funny Movies”, “Movies that make me cry”, etc. Then if you were feeling a certain way you could find a certain list and find what you want. Overall though, very fun app.

Every time when I want to know what the episode is about I can read it until the very last line. If it were not for this one thing the app would be a perfect 5. So far that is my only problem and I hope that it gets fixed in a future update.
title: Could’ve been a 5 Star

review: My issue with the app is even after I thumbs down selections, days later they remain in my suggestions. Especially foreign language movies that are not even remotely similar to what I watch (genre). Yeah, it looks pretty but unless I know something specific, I am stuck with stuff I won’t and can’t watch. Tried making a new profile from scratch and it was the same issues. I gave it only two stars because yes, it’s smoother looking and yes, I can access profiles a lot easier. But overall, I’m seriously debating leaving Netflix all together since all they want me to do is watch stuff where I don’t even know what they are saying...
title: Recommendations Not Helpful

review: I used the app yesterday morning and then I updated it to the new update and now, even with my secure internet connection and the fact that it’s my own personal network (and nobody can use it but me due to my strong firewall and passcode) but every time I open the app it just loads and loads and loads. I let my phone sit unlocked with the app open (and no other apps open) but even after an hour it didn’t load whatsoever. I have the best WiFi in my room with full bars so I’m confused as to why the update broke the app. Please fix this because I’d like to watch Netflix again.
title: New Update Ruined the App

review: Hi readers out there! I just want to say that Netflix is truly how I spend most of my “lazy days” and all of my hours that I should be doing important things but I’d rather watch my shows ;). I have spent the last three days inside watching Netflix. Some could say I have a problem, but most will just congratulate me on my commitment to this kind of lifestyle: the lifestyle of caring more about fictional worlds and what happens in them rather than caring about the real world 👍. That’s just how I role my dudes. Peace out ✌️.
title: My love: Netflix

review: I like the fact that there’s a selection of movies to choose from. Since the last updates things are not looking well. For example...when removing shows or movies added to my list that I have watched already and have removed from the list they are still showing on it. I would like to keep what I have added without having to go through each show or movie to check if it has the check mark letting me know that I added it to the list. Please fix this problem.
title: Mostly Good

review: I was liking the Netflix app just fine until today when I got the latest update. The “bug fixes” addressed by the update changed the video player interface in less-than-desirable ways, such as no longer being able to pause by tapping the middle of the screen or jump forward or back using the sides of the screen. Also, for some reason playing videos now overrides my iPad settings of reducing the white point on my display. Since this was a work around to keep the integrity of colors on my screen, my Netflix now appears with severely distorted colors. I hope they can fix the bugs they made with this update.

Like I start watching a show and get attached to it and then I find out it’s being taken off in like a week and I barely have time to watch my show. If this problem bothers you guys too, I would really suggest  to pay for HBO max instead. There is a bigger variety of movies and shows and there is no end. Pls stop taking the shows off of Netflix

review:
I’ve had a subscription for several years and I’ve been happy with the performance watching different media when streaming at home. However, I travel weekly for work and your app is garbage. I’ll downloaded shows and halfway through my flight, it’ll stop and I’ll just get the spinning wheel. I can’t rewind or fast forward through your flawed download. Additionally, you want to say that my paid for, subscription downloaded show has “expired!” or I’ve reached the download “limit?!” First of all, I wouldn’t re-download a show if it didn’t “expire.”
Get your *stuff together Netflix. I pay you so I can watch your media. Not to have you tell me when it’s convenient for you.

title: Best app EVER !!!

review:
I love Netflix. The app is mostly cool, but I can’t use it to stream videos from my phone onto my projector if I have plans to hear it at all. 

I don’t own a TV. I just have my phone, and a projector. When I first got my projector, maybe a year or two ago, I could plug in my phone and watch no problems. Then, there was an update that wouldn’t allow sound to be played through projector. I got a Bluetooth speaker to make it work and now with this new update not even that works. 

I just want to watch Netflix on my projector with ease, why is the option to connect to a Bluetooth device no longer available?
title: Why don’t you want me to hear your content?!

review: I love Netflix and I think it has great shows and movies. But, I really really wish that the shows came out weekly instead of coming out as a whole season. I really wish I could watch it now though

title: Easy fix for company, extreme inconvenience for a customer.
review: The settings on the app prevent permanent language change, so the program always defaults to  English for deaf, announcing each action on the screen. I am unable to change this on my Apple TV as I’m redirected to customer service. This is time consuming and is a disincentive to continue paying for or using Netflix. This seems like an easy fix, so I’m surprised this persists, especially on the highest price point apple devices. Fix ASAP!

title: Netflix is great but i have an issue with this “ update”
review: I haven’t had a problem with Netflix before but today when I go to watch my show ( it’s called dead to me it’s a really good show btw) and on the side of the screen it shows like the weather and a search bar and a who’s watching thing and it really bothers me because it covers up my show. Is there a way that I could  like take it off so it’s not there? Or is it permanent and I just have to deal with it?

title: Needs more updated movies and episodes
review: Netflix is great and all and I totally recommend it. But it doesn’t update the new episodes of some of my favorite shows. For example, one of my favorite shows is “One day at a time” and season 4 is still not on Netflix. Season 4 came out a few months ago and I’m still waiting. If there are no updated episodes how are you suppose to keep rewatching to series? Eventually you get bored don’t you? Anyway, it’s a great app but I need to stay entertained by the show and I can’t keep watching the same episodes over and over again.

title: Cannot download on new device bc downloads on factory reset iPad were not deleted beforehand
review: I recently upgraded my iPad and did not delete one downloaded movie from previous device before doing a factory reset. Netflix unhelpfully told me a factory reset does not delete download on their part and I need to wait one month before the movie expires to download on my new device. Or I can upgrade my plan. Utterly unhelpful customer service, Netflix. And seems like a technical glitch to me. Can I remind you you are not the only game in town anymore, there are a lot more streaming services and they are expanding, better work on that customer service.

title: Kind of meh
review: Netflix is a great app that almost always has a great selection of films and shows. Despite this some of the formatting for the mobile version could be improved. It now shows previews for shows that you click on. These previews cannot be canceled until they are done. Also the price for the App has been increasing at a high rate despite the fact that most of the selections haven’t improved too much. Lastly, the app cycles through movies too quickly and often removes them after quite a short time. It also promotes its Netflix originals a lot, despite the fact that most of them aren’t anything exceptional.

title: New maturity rating is out of line
review: As a parent who uses the App Store maturity rating to help control what my kids have access to I am extremely shocked and upset that sometime over the past few days this app has changed from 9+ to 12+ (and category that includes the majority of questionable social media apps) when the internal Netflix controls already allow for much greater control over material for younger family members.  Now my children cannot access the app, and their personalized accounts, because I am not comfortable opening their devices to 12+ rating apps. If the age rating cannot be reversed for whatever reason that I can’t make any sense of, perhaps you can release a Netflix kids app?

review:
First Netflix was outraged by how much money they were losing from people sharing their Netflix account with others, now they are giving link encouraging them to use it? 
Cmon, 
Please do not share the “gift” link Netflix gives y’all its just a way for Netflix to keep an eye on how many members share their account with others. Y’all should know nothing is a free gift from greedy companies. Share your account login info manually, do not share the link they so generously give people to “help” them share the account. It’s just a way to keep tags on people and their money. it’s despicable.

title: Maybe you should add...
review: Hey! Netflix is SUCH a great app, I really recommend it whenever you want to watch some TV shows or old movies you haven’t seen in a while, even though it costs money. This review is about the shows, though. That’s so Raven. That’s so Raven used to be on Netflix and then all of a sudden, you guys just...DELETED it! That’s so Raven hasn’t been on Netflix for years! That’s so Raven is one of the most loved 2000’s shows on Disney channel. I know that for a FACT! Please add it back. That’s all I gotta say. Please.

title: Fantastic but never perfect
review: The title says it. I’ve a subscriber since it’s inception. I guess the lack of feature constancy between the app formats is mildly agitating and the thumbs up/down rating system blows. I would like that if you give a feature a poor rating that it would disappear from your selections. Other wise it’s solid and I will keep on keepin’ on especially as they keep coming out with stunning original content. (A few more major releases in the streaming library would be good but I’m sure that’s more just legal issues).

title: READ THIS
review: I love Netflix but I also love one direction and I am very mad that they are taking “One direction This is us “ of of Netflix we just got it back and now you are taking it away why most you destroy my dreams this make me very sad and a lot of other people are also sad too I am also very sad that Netflix is taking off “The Vampire Diaries” that show is the peanut butter to my jelly and so is the One Direction movie you see if they just left the One Direction movie and The Vampire Diaries alone then I would have gave them a five stars but they are going to take them off of Netflix so that is why I am giving Netflix one star so thanks for making me sad I still love Netflix I just they would leave those two things alone

title: Downloads
review: I live in nyc and take the subway so I usually download shoes and movies onto my phone since there’s no service.  My question is, why is there a time limit on how long I have to watch an episode before the download deletes? On top of that, there’s a limit to how many times you can download certain movies/ shows. Why am I paying for this app then? It honestly makes no sense. Don’t increase your prices if you’re not going to provide better service. I should be able to download whatever show I want and not worry about my downloads getting deleted if I don’t watch the show for a while. Now I can’t even redownload that episode.

title: Get it together, Netflix!
review: I have been a Netflix customer for years. I loved the service and quite a few of the shows they produced. However, they recently raised their prices and said it was due to them making more of their own shows. Many of these new series and movies are awful. It appears Netflix has decided in favor of quantity over quality. Yes, they put out a lot of their own productions, but it wasn’t worth the increase in price. Now, they will be losing several shows and series that I actually watch. I am now considering cancelling our subscription. Why should I pay more for something that I will now use less?

title: It’s a great app but... uh...
review: So I had an account from a while back, and eventually had to stop paying, for reasons, and today I decided I want to start using netflix again, so I go to my subscriptions and choose a plan, not knowing that they delete your account after 10 months... so now I’ve made a whole new account, with the same email but I have to pay again, this kinda bothers me, could I get my money back for the account I thought I had but don’t?

title: Netflix isn’t secure
review:
I love Netflix, but I think there’s something wrong with it, I often check my account to see if there’s anyone watching who is not authorized. I noticed there were people watching in the account from Florida and Pennsylvania (I’m in Ohio). I changed my password and 2 days later I checked back and there’s people watching from Colorado and Pennsylvania. What the heck is going on Netflix. I have authorized a couple family members to watch and they are both in Cincinnati with me. 
I don’t want to have to change my password weekly.

title: Good app but change one thing
review: I like this app but I want you to change one thing you in every series or movies there will be a response section where you can type in things you think about the movies and series or you could tell the developer to add a season and this will go straight to the developers but not the Netflix developers the real developers and I hope it comes soon and other Netflix fans will like this version of Netflix and thank you

title: Please fix the MY LIST category
review: I love Netflix and I spend the majority of my day watching different things via the Netflix app. The only problem I have as of now is that when I select my list, it still contains titles that I have removed from MY LIST! I don’t quite understand why this issue hasn’t been fixed yet but hopefully it is resolved soon. Also, would it be possible to show the most recent things added to my lift first. I would much rather see the titles I’ve added to my list today or yesterday, show up first, rather than the titles I’ve added 3 months ago!!!

title: What happened to the descriptions?
review:
I cannot speak for the version of Netflix that would stream on a TV screen since I watch mostly on my tablet, but I have no problem offering a low rating for the recent app update that eliminates program descriptions of any kind. This deceitful omission is fine for movies I have already seen and shows that I still watch, but the vague tags are a poor substitute for a summary that would actually touch on the plot of a show/movie previously unknown to the viewer. 
  We’ve already had to deal with a useless rating system and “match” percentages that are based more on public popularity than actual relation to what we watch, and now we have one more reason to ignore new material.

title: The Big Play Button
review:
I love Netflix hands down, but recently the past month in a half or so the play button, rewind and fast forward was an option in the middle of the screen. And now I’m just realizing it’s changed back!? Idk if it’s just my phone but it’s better the other way with the big play button in the middle of the screen. Before all the time I would rewind by accident instead of pausing or playing the movie!! Welp that’s it
Ps. Idk if the company is going to see this  or just for people to download the app or not.......

title: Suggestion filters based on Ethnicity
review: I love all the movies and tv episodes available to watch.  I love to watch lots of different things based on my mood at the time.  I usually choose to watch a movie based on a story summary or category (romantic, food, comedy,...).  I am frustrated that after I watch something that has actors/actresses of a specific ethnicity;  the suggestions appear to be based primarily on that ethnicity.  I like movies with African Americans, Indians, Spaniards, Asians, Italians, ...   I want my movies suggestions based on categories first.  If I wanted movie suggestions based on ethnicity, I would choose to search based on that.

title: Deleting app and canceling
review: Nothing but Old movies that no one wanted to watch when they came out the first time and Boring comedy routing that just talk about politics from a very liberal perspective and insult the president. (Which is fine, it’s their opinion. I just don’t want to hear about it because it’s not real comedy.) If I wanted to watch this I would watch CNN not Netflix. Netflix has become far to liberal and politically involved for my taste, you hear it enough on tv I don’t want to hear about it on an app I’m paying for. I don’t want to watch liberal comedy because it isn’t funny, I want real unbiased jokes that are actually funny not political and I don’t want to hear anything about the worst president this country has ever had (B. Hussein Obama)

title: Used to work, now fails to recognize password though website does
review:
The Netflix app suddenly stopped streaming and all searches failed to bring up results. I removed/reinstalled the app but an error popped up saying I had an “incorrect email or password”. So I signed into the website and my login saved in Keychain worked perfect. I returned to the app and tried signing in again and the same error, “incorrect email or password”. Recover password in the app was nonfunctional.
I signed into the website (with the password the app says is incorrect) and changed the password. Returned to the app with the new password ... guess what. “Incorrect email or password”. Guess it is hard to afford enough software QA in the Bay Area nowadays.

title: Netflix app on iPad
review: This 5 star rating is for the excellent app on iPad. I can sit on my dining room table eating dinner and have no problem watching my shows with my WiFi connection, unlike some other apps where the show I’m watching constantly freezes up (for example the xfinity app). On the other hand I’m rating Netflix 3 stars for some of the awful recent changes. For the most part I still consider Netflix to be worth the money, hence the reason for 3 stars instead of 1 star.

title: No Automatic play when streaming & using Dock Connector
review:
I was so happy about a month ago when Netflix’s update finally allowed automatic play when using the Apple dock connector, streaming to my television. With the recent update (or perhaps even the previous one before) now it won’t automatic play anymore. if I’m docked to my television I have to get up and manually play the next episode. 
It stinks that app developers aren’t conceiving of how its users are actually, practically using the apps in the real world. A lot of people use a dock connector to stream to their TV. It would be nice if Netflix could resolve that issue.

title: Please read this and fix it
review:
It's is a great app and all but I don't know if I am the only one struggling with this problem but it keeps saying I can't play this title instantly and then it says try a different title I don't know why this is happening but if you guys can do an update that would be great. October 7, 2017 update I wanted to come back and say thanks for fixing the last error that occurred but now every time I want to watch Netflix it loads and then crashes 

                Thanks

title: Great streaming service, but app has issues
review: There is a giant reoccurring issue I keep having that is too annoying for me to ignore. I’m definitely in the minority with this issue as most users probably won’t have it, let me explain. I am not a fan of anime dubs, so I watch with subtitles. The issue is every like 5 minutes or so, the subtitles randomly disappear and I’m left with Japanese dialogue I can’t understand. So I have to continuously close Netflix and re open it just to watch my show! This is my only complaint with the app, please fix it Netflix. Oh and if it helps, I’m using Netflix on a IPhone XR.

title: a letter of disappointment
review: upon a recent boring night i decided to watch ‘to all the boys i’ve loved before 3’.  if you can’t tell where this is going, then you haven’t watched to all the boys i’ve loved before 3. this movie is single handedly the fall of our crumbling civil society, to be even more specific, in the words of someone to blame, "It matters not what you've done, but what you do with what you've done for others.” fall were you thinking when constructing the script of this piece? did you think young adults would enjoy watching someone make poor choice after poor choice upon trying to please her boyfriend? no. you weren’t. the star i gave us solely for octonaughts, don’t delete the show it’s great.

title: Slowly going downhill..
review:
Don’t get me wrong.. Netflix still has some good options of shows and movies to watch. But I think it’s absolutely ridiculous that Netflix would take off so many of their most popular shows (yes I’m still upset about friends and the office) then have the audacity to INCREASE the price. I know that each show has a contract with whatever streaming service or TV network, but y’all should not be upping the price if your taking everything worth watching off.

ALSO, Cuties, and the original movies that mock Christianity are absolutely DISGUSTING. The people who own and work for Netflix should be ashamed of themselves for creating that and allow that to happen.

title: Amazing

review: I have had Netflix for quite a while and I have had few app issues until lately. Almost every time I open the app and select an account on my mobile device the screen freezes on the main menu and won’t let me select a show. On the slim times I can, the screen while watching the show has a delayed reaction to any time I pause or skip or access the menu like closed captions or episodes. The app is great but the recent updates have seemed to cause these issues. I hope they can be resolved in a future update.
title: Freezing and Crashing

review: I’ve used this app for over 6 years now and it was an absolute joy. Hours upon hours of different shows and movies spread across different genres. The UI was intuitive and user friendly, the recommended usually hit right on the dime, and the movies were actually quite entertaining. But what kind of movie is Cuties and why do you think it’s okay to film underage children performing what is basically soft core porn. It is disgusting. It can’t even be played off as a “mistake” because there had to be funding for this movie, a crew for this movie, and production for this movie. This is only enjoyable to literal pedophiles and that disgusts me, this one movie completely ruined my view on Netflix.

title: Please bring back some movies

review:
I and my family have really enjoyed Netflix over the years. The one thing that would be useful in the app would be a better search algorithm that includes tag searching. I would like to be able to search specific years and what were the top 10 or top 20 movies of that year and perhaps by a certain actors or genres. 

Can you please work on implementing tag searching by description, title, director, cast, year, rating, genre, language?

title: I need more anime!

But now, with the previews, I can’t open the app and peacefully look through selections and make my choice. Even if I ‘mute’ the previews they still play with sound. Sometimes if I pause the show I’m watching and start playing it again later, it starts playing with two sound tracks, one from the show I’m watching and the other one from whatever show is being previewed on the home page. Please, please, make a way for us to stop this feature.
