title: LOVE IT but one suggestion

review:
The auto-continue-playing “feature” is excruciatingly annoying. I want to watch credits after a show or film, but the screen shrinks down, and I can’t read anything. So I try to rewind to read some end credits, but it’s an annoying game of pausing it in time before the screen shrinks down. 
Trailers auto-playing is equally annoying. One, I only want to watch trailers that I choose. And Two, there’s junk floating on top of the video. 
Netflix wants their customers to keep watching content, but their methods can easily annoy viewers and force them to find workarounds or fight with a countdown to watch what they want to watch. 
Netflix needs only to add some optional settings to remedy this.
title: All Netflix apps are terrible

review: So I love Netflix I think it’s very cool but I think it needs more shows and it haves to have the full seasons ,like for example icarly haves 2 seasons on Netflix but the show haves 6 seasons so if you can please add more shows and more kid shows because I have a daughter and there is more adult shows then kids so I recommend you add more shows like spongebob and more things because if you want people to buy this app or get it you need to make people want to get it so please read and think about this.
title: Please read this if you care

review:
Within the past week, I’ve become increasingly annoyed and disappointed in the Netflix app. First, it wasn’t displaying subtitles at the right time and would be minutes from what the people on screen were actually saying. Practically useless for my friends who quite literally cannot hear the actors as they’re deaf. 
Secondly, now, whenever I try to watch ANY title on my phone, it comes up with an error message that it’s unavailable to watch. At this point, I’m considering just deleting the app and cancelling my subscription as I’m paying far too much for a subscription that only works half the time at best. 
Wish I could rate less than one star, this is getting ridiculous.
title: Refuses to work

review: The content fluctuates some good, lots bad, granted Hollywood has the bar so low everyone else looks like a genius. Now an even more political company as Obama sponsors. Netflix is a pain for me. They fight VPN use which is universally accepted as more secure. It’s ridiculous. We wouldn’t we want users to be more secure? This means you can’t put your router on a VPN if any of your devices use Netflix. This allows your ISP to spy on your usage, sell your data etc. Not to mention the lack of overall security. If you have no faith in your login system fix that! Are we not tired of everything taking priority over privacy yet? Punish all for the statistically insignificant bad few.
title: Anti security (VPN, proxy)

review: I always fight this! I had the fire stick playing in my daughters room on Netflix and Netflix playing on the Xbox in the living room and I turned off the tv in her room so I can watch tv on my phone and she can watch tv on the Xbox while she eats. title: Needs an update!

review: Great job to the guys and gals at Netflix! Netflix truly is the future: it’s cheap and easily affordable, has an amazing selection of films and shows, and I can watch on my phone, tablet, computer, Xbox, PS4; you name the device and you can watch Netflix on it. And don’t even get me started on the Netflix Originals: Stranger Things, The Punisher, Daredevil, Luke Cage, Iron Fists, The Defenders, Peaky Blinders, Black Mirror, and the list goes on. Geez, I thought I said not to get me started on the Originals. The point is- Netflix is a must have. 10/10

That’s my only gripe so far using the app.

I love Netflix, but has anyone else noticed the slight glitches in the app? I’m talking about how sometimes the screen will go black when you’re watching something, or how it’s stopped tracking the episodes you’ve watched so you have to remember which episode you stopped at, or maybe how sometimes the auto play won’t appear on screen and so when you manually have to skip to the next episode it just replays that same episode with the next episodes name at the top? 

It’s just been really annoying to me and I think it needs to be patched up.

Netflix is Awesome!! 🥰😘❤️😍😻💘💞💓💗❣️💕💜🖤🧡💛💚💙💝💖♥️
review:
I have watched Netflix for such a long time and have been so patient with having new things come out and new seasons to come out and they finally did. My little brother also likes watching shows on Netflix but he watches the same thing over and over again. I want there to be more seasons of what he watches and what I watch like for Motown Magic and Alexa and Katie for me. I also want there to be a lot more teen selections like Alexa and Katie as well. Other than these problems, I think Netflix is awesome and AMAZING 😉

title: Progress and bugs

Well for one I think you should bring back older shows like for example Full house or more Pokémon movies. Also I read review from Cinder2014 and I agree there’s a Adult section with most shows I can’t watch and a kids section that have little kid shows , so there should be a teen/Tween section in Between movies and shows. Also sometimes when I’m watching something my screen will freeze so if you can please fix that bug

title: Great but has a few issues
review: Don’t get me wrong, I love Netflix. Nothing’s better than watching Friends at 2am. But I’d love for Netflix to include more options. The selection is great, but newer more popular movies would be great. Also I’ve been struggling to reach my account from the app. I can’t clear my history from the app because the Account button isn’t on my app. Don’t know if this is a new update or something, but it’s really annoying! Overall a great investment, but please help me figure out this browsing history thing :(

review:
Hi excuse me so I was wondering if I could ask if you guys can put the movie called the original goosebumps? I do not mean the series one! and I do not mean the 2nd one! I mean the first one which I hope it’s okay with you guys oh and don’t get rid of the goosebumps stuff okay please don’t really hope you guys can put the original one okay thank you. Oh and

Ps. I putted five stars because you guys have really good experience on this app great job I love this app 😄

title: Customer Service 👎
review: I recently opened a new account for a relative as a present in a different state. Decided to go about it the right way, and pay for the service; instead of just giving said relative my password. It stated there was a 30 day free trial, however, days later Netflix’s algorithm saw same card paying for 2 accounts. So they cancelled the free trial without reaching out to me, and charged the card right away. Contact customer service, “Our rules state we can’t do anything for you.” Click, they Han up. I call a 2nd time, “Our system want even allow us to credit a future month free. Better off cancelling now, and we refund you. Then give your relative your password.” $@&?!!!! Netflix.

title: Gotta step up
review: I love Netflix I watch everyday! But you guys need to allow iPhones to automatically play the next episode without have to select it, or being on WiFi! Second, update the movies! I’m into anime, regular television series, and of course movies! Disney and old time favorites need to be cycled into selections, these other movies are just ugh! You also take down good movies in short time frames and leave crappy movies up there forever! As I said love Netflix for my shows as far as kids selections and others I’m not to thrilled

title: Really need to make a customizable child profile.
review: I love Netflix and my child loves watching it in the car. It definitely keeps her occupied during the drive. However, because I can’t block undesired content, she often navigates to inappropriate material while I’m driving and I cannot change it or turn it off while I’m driving. There needs to be a way to just show them content we have approved for them to view. They don’t need all these suggested shows or other categories. I’m happy to have Netflix shove that stuff down my throat on adult profiles, but not my kid’s profile.

title: New update kills app (10.9.0 - May 29th '18)
review:
UPDATE: Netflix has fixed the problem and the service is working again. 

I have an iPhone X running iOS 11.4.1 Public Beta 1 (15G5054c). The app will not open and just spins the loading icon endlessly. I have tried hard resetting my phone and reinstalling the app. Now, on the login screen, I enter my information and I get an "Incorrect email or password" message. Logging in on the website with the same information, however, works just fine. This is terrible. Please fix Netflix...

title: Errors, errors everywhere
review: When I download an episode I expect to be able to watch it without an internet connection, when I play a downloaded episode it just stays there buffering as if I was streaming and when I don’t have signal it just shows an error notification saying no connection or no explanation at all, when the app works offline, which I’d say is 30% of the time it works well but otherwise it’s too inconvenient, if this issue isn’t fix I’m probably gonna unsubscribe since I watch most of my content through downloading and not streaming.  Seriously disappointed with this latest update.

title: It’s mostly good
review: I really enjoy the app. It has a large selection of movies and shows, and I can easily watch them. My only problem is the continue watching list. It’s helpful when I haven’t finished something yet and want to continue. But, sometimes I’ll be watching a movie, and then I’ll decide I don’t like it. I don’t want to finish it, but I can’t just remove it from my continue watching. This is annoying because I don’t want it there, and I should be able to get rid of it. Other than that, it’s a very good app.

title: Good but could be great
review:
The app NEEDS a “restart” movie button in addition to resume. I have had numerous occasions when I have wanted to restart a
movie for my daughter and I have to resume than jump it back, such a hassle! It even restarts when we made it to the credits the time before. In addition, they should bring back the star ratings!! It’s so hard to assess if a movie will be any good and I keep wasting my time starting bad movies. I despise the thumbs up/thumbs down scale it’s annoying and doesn’t seem to even take in account what I like or dislike. You must bring back the star ratings.

title: SO. GOOD. Just a few things to say!
review:
Hi! So I’ve been using Netflix for a LONG time. Obviously I love it (who doesn’t?) but I do have some suggestions. Sometimes, in shows, it only shows like a random season. Or my favorite shows get removed. Or in shows like iCarly, the episodes are out of order. They’ll talk about something that was supposed to happen like 2 episodes ago but instead, it’s the last episode so it sometimes doesn't make sense. Please stop removing shows NO ONE wants removed and please put episodes in order!

~Allie

title: Please do this!!!
review: I don't know if it's my iPad/phone but the 1st 4 seasons of bones are not on there for some reason if it's you could you please add them back!! Also can you put wizards of waverly ( not sure if that's right I haven't watched in a long time because it was taken off ) place!!! Aldo can you add Hannah Montana back on too I love it!! Can you also add Caillou back on and Jessie. Jessie is my all time favorite Disney channel show and now I can't watch it so please please please add those things back on.

title: Shrinking credits
review: Right when The cast names come up in the credits for a series show I just watched the screen shrinks and is unreadable.  If I click back to it to maximize it it’s too late to read it. If I rewind a bit to try and read the cast credits, it shrinks agaiiiiin! I know not everyone likes credits but some do and it should at least be an option to see them.  I do pay for the entire movie or episode...not a portion of it, right? Is Netflix getting too big to care about the viewer experience and only the $$? ...and this issue is not affected by turning off auto play of next episode.

title: No offline watching!
review:
Extremely disappointing that offline watching doesn’t work. Downloaded a few movies for a long plane trip. Tried to start the app to watch on the plane, but the app doesn’t even start without Internet connection! Just keeps saying “Error connecting to network”. So I paid $10 for Internet for an hour. This way, I could watch one movie. When trying to start the next one, again it didn’t work as the app needed to reconnect to the Internet for whatever reason. Didn’t want to pay another $10. Very frustrating.
Note that after a downloaded movie has started, no Internet connection is required, but to start the movie, it is. False advertising.

title: Questions
review:
I’m not writing a review and this may be a problem for Apple iPads and iPhones but if I watch for maybe three hours the program goes into a loop and won’t run. After several what seams like minutes of watching the little circle go around and around a message come up and says “can’t play movie right now try again later “.  You have to just put it away because it won’t work.  I hate that.

I can run it on my kindle and it does fine.  I am so frustrated.  Why can’t they fix that problem.

Also I used to use my phone LTE service to run Netflix now it keeps telling me it has to have internet.  What happened?

title: Attention to major detail
review: I have no problem with Netflix in general, they are a great streaming provider, but they pay almost no attention to making sure their mobile app works correctly. On my iPhone and my iPad the app crashes constantly. I looked up the problem and according to their tech support, that only happens when the app isn’t up to date. That would be nice if it were true. I haven’t been able to use Netflix as intended by design in 2 years because I have to go into the app with WiFi and data off and quickly reactivate it again while in the app and it still crashes 70% of the time doing that. Good streaming provider, bad attention to app functionality.

title: What’s up with the screen orientation??
review: I’ll have my phone flipped a certain way, but when I load a show it’ll automatically flip to default, which is the opposite of what I want. So, I flip the phone around a couple times until the app recognizes I changed the orientation. Finally. I can watch my show. BUT. If I close out the show, (staying in the app) and load another one, the app will re-flip the orientation. It’s beyond irritating! Why won’t it automatically recognize which way I have the phone? It used to just flip as soon as the app opened instead of me manually having to flip it.

title: Stationed overseas, can’t get US Netflix.
review: If you’re a US military member stationed overseas, without a lot of effort, some additional expense, and possibly putting yourself at legal risk, you won’t get US Netflix, even though you’ve paid for it.  Netflix’s tech crew are very good.  They have made it impossible to get US Netflix in Europe.  Though you may pay for a VPN service or set up your own, you will lose your access or will need to be satisfied with European Netflix.  That being said, there are still a few good movies and shows to see, but you can also find about as many at your post library.

title: Netflix is cool and all, but...
review: It would be great if this service added the option to lock your own profile with a password so that if you share an account with others, it’ll keep prying hands and eyes away from seeing your watch history, deleting your account, and changing the profile picture/name. It’d be very helpful as it’s obnoxious having to keep making a whole new profile because the kids who use the account keep deleting it. That’s really the only complaint I have. I’m leaving two stars since this has been an issue for several years and they still haven’t added it.

title: Really Great app but...
review: This app is great, but I have some complaints.  They have so many options with tv shows. They only have half the seasons for example Henry Danger & Go live your way. While this is annoying it’s better than sling. Sling has almost every season but they don’t have the episodes they skip over them. While Netflix is better it is annoying when the great shows are missing seasons I had to watch sling to finish Henry danger and I missed half the episodes on it. I prefer Netflix but it has flaws.

title: Pausing
review: Netflix is great and has some great shows but for a while now I’ve been trying to watch it on my tablet and it always pauses! Sometimes 2-4 times in one minute! I contacted Netflix before and they said it was my internet provider but it only happens on my tablet. On my phone it works good. I’m frustrated because it should work just fine since it’s the same company as my phone. If the problem keeps occurring I’m going to have to cancel my subscription, what’s the point of having it if it won’t properly work on the one device I want to watch it on.

title: Subtitles
review: I can’t see the subtitles when they are completely white so I change them to have a black background. I go back into the app, it works for one episode but when the next episode comes on, their back to the white with no background that I can’t see. Why? Now every single episode I have to go back to safari change the subtitles once again, swipe off Netflix and then go back in to get the subtitles that aren’t even the ones I chose just for me to watch my shows. It’s very annoying. Trust me I do try to deal with the white with no background but then if there’s is a scene in the show that is white as well...

title: Profile Pictures.
review: I love how their profile pictures for your profile on Netflix but I feel like there should be an option for animes preferably Netflix originals. some Netflix originals should have the option to be able to be set as a profile pictures. Some of these Netflix original anime are Kakegurui, Devilman Crybaby, and Saiki K. also I think an option should be able to be importing images from your camera roll as a profile picture. I think Netflix and their team should take this into consideration overall, but this is a great app. Thanks for reading my review!!

title: Five stars
review: Netflix is great not only just Netflix but the workers and the people who answer the phones and put up with annoying people and Karens I was messing with one of the workers over a chat and they told me to stay safe and healthy and now I feel bad so I’m writing this I’m sorry to all the workers and people who answer phones not just at Netflix but all the people who answer phones and deal with people like me everywhere and so I’m going to give you this five star rating

title: Deleting Shows/Movies
review: I love this app so much, it is easy to use also! But when I get onto this app to watch my favorite show, it is gone, I understand it is apart of how the app works. But it would be nice for those who watch a certain show/movies can keep it while if others don’t it can be removed for them. Just the other day I wanted to watch one of the older Monster High movies, but it was not there. However this is just my opinion, and I understand if you have a reason to delete certain things.

title: I’m IN LOVE with Netflix!
review: This app is beyond better then any other paid streaming service! It has tons of great movies and shows on it, so i’m always watching. If I had to say one thing, it would be to make removing things from the “currently watching” section easier than having to sign in on a Laptop. If you start watching something you don’t like or click on it by accident, it will stay on your currently watching list for who knows how long! But despite this, I love this app and everything else is great.

title: Amazing but GIVE ME BACK MY JAWS
review: I really like Netflix. It sorts and recommends which content to watch and I highly recommend it. I would have definitely given it a hundred stars, before almost a year ago. Netflix took my best friend away. Yes ladies and gentlemen, that’s right. YOU TOOK AWAY MY JAWS COLLECTION AND REMOVED IT FROM THE WHOLE NETFIX CONTENT!!!!! Never had I ever been so insulted in my entire life. The joy in my life was watching the man eating shark take over a community. Jaws, Jaws 2, Jaws 3, and Jaws: The Revenge, were life changing to me. I now rely on tv shows and that’s still pretty good. But please, give me back my Jaws!!! 😭🦈

          I also love the show Mr. Young, but when season three disappeared, it got boring watching the same episodes over and over. Please, please, please add season three back. If you can’t, can you at least explain to me why you took it off? Thank you for reading!

title: Needs to play nice with others
review:
We have had Netflix way back when they were shipping DVDS. We like it, but are taking away 2 stars:
-1: not integrating with Apple TV app. We use that as our dashboard and Disney+, Prime, and TV+ all integrate well. We are opening Netflix less and less because we’re tired of having to go to each app. 
-1: for force feeding Netflix original content and auto playing previews. It needs to be more transparent what’s being recommended but it feels like I haven’t seen a non-Netflix recommendation in months. 

Netflix, please wake up before the others eat your lunch.

title: Netflix

title: Great but better ideas
review: This app is great! I just wish there were more cheer shows. Especially more seasons to Cheer Squad everyone at my school wants another season! You could get another cheer team and add it to cheer squad. I also wish you had a tween/teen program instead of “kids program” everything on there for 3 to 5 year old kids. Okay, so when I watch a movie or a show, half the time it says I’m still watching it, when clearly it shows I have watched it. I have ocd, and it frustrates me, because I try to rewatch it and skip through it to the end so it will go away, but it doesn’t. Once, I watched it and it went away, and I was happy, then it came back around a week later. Please fix this. It would be great if you could tell me if I’m doing something wrong, or that you would fix it. Thanks.
title: Why is it still in my continue watching?

review: Great app! A few glitches every once in a while but nothing too bad. Why did you take R.L. Stine’s The Haunting Hour off? title: 5 stars!

review:
I’ve noticed that on almost all of the shows, half of the captions are wrong, I’ve sometimes misheard something so I have to turn on the subtitles to see what it said, and it’s nothing like what it sounds like, I find this issue mostly in anime, I’ll be watching English versions of anime and almost all of the subtitles are wrong. And I get that it’s a Japanese show and it’s hard to translate, but you LITERALLY HAVE AN ENGLISH VERSION OF MOST ANIMES AND THE ENGLISH CAPTIONS ARE STILL WRONG.

Also can you add a 10 seconds forward button please😂
title: Pretty great, but a few flaws that just really annoy me

review:
This is absolutely great! I’ve been using Netflix for so long, and never wrote a review for it, so here I am. I’m only a kid, but please listen. Voltron. Voltron, Voltron, Voltron. My friends on Recolor told me season 8 would be the last season. I cried so hard, please tell the creators to continue! I love the five paladins, Keith especially. I even adored Lotor at a time, and Crolia, my absolute favorite character. I would be so disappointed if it discontinued, so please try your best to add more seasons. 
From, a fan girl. 
Sorry if it autocorrects.
title: This is amazing!

review: After years away from Netflix, I came back for an old show.  Watched it, but can’t find anything else to watch because I have no clue what these shows are about now!!  Have to use IMDB to see a synapsis of the show, and who’s in it.  Also, still no fast forward button on the app?  After doing away with the old rating system (does a thumbs up really adjust your recommendations?), descriptions, and still no skip option, I’m not seeing the value...all their money is going toward their branded shows and movies it seems!  As it’s looking now, I won’t be participating after my free trial ends.  At least there’s a month free now!
title: New User

review: My family and I have had Netflix for 5 years now and had never stopped loving it and the content it offers. However, with one of the recent updates, the summary feature was taken away and now you can’t read what the show or movie is about without watching a trailer or going into the move blindly. Although a trailer might give you some insight to the story line, some of the tv shows and movies included on Netflix don’t  have a trailer. In my opinion, this feature shouldn’t have been removed and hopefully will be reinstalled in the near future.

title: I love it

Now if you really want a better all around choice of a more eclectic choice of movies, you should choose TUBI, and best of all, which is FREE. title: Pretty Boring Stuff...

review:
Netflix, 
 Yes, Blue Exorcist came out in 2011, but can you please incorporate season 2 and if there are more can you please incorporate any seasons after that. I saw that on the “coming soon” list new seasons of shows similar to Blue Exorcist were being added, and I humbly ask that you please put season 2 of the show on. -A
title: Blue Exorcist Season 2 PLEASE
Respect The Credits
review: There is a disturbing trend in the media to cut the credits at the end of a show or movie. Unfortunately Netflix has embraced this tactic. If you cannot respect the talent that created the presentation, at least acknowledge that your paying viewer may want the opportunity to see who it was that played a particular role, or who operated the camera, or who designed the costumes and sets. At the very least, add a choice to retain the end credits all the way to the copyright date and final FBI warning. It literally is part of the production. Hence only four stars.

title: What happened?
review:
Look I have been watching Netflix for years. I have enjoyed being able to watch tons of great content.
But, lately I have been disappointed in so much of their original content- is everything serial murderers, violence and horror with some comedy thrown in for good measure? It seems like most of their new content, while beautifully filmed, is written with teenage boys in mind! I am beginning to rethink how vital Netflix is to me.
Another thing, what is with the “reminders” to finish watching something I’ve started😡 I’m not a child and I don’t need Big Brother telling me how to watch a show and I especially don’t need more junk in my mailbox!

title: Overpriced and not enough content
review: Netflix has had its ups and downs over the years, but I think it’s peaked.  It simply doesn’t offer enough content, and doesn’t update its contents regularly enough.  Recently coming back from an international trip it was even more infuriating to realize how much content can only be seen in select countries, but what’s bizarre is that so much of the content unavailable to a subscriber is created in their own country!  Netflix really needs to up their game and offer way more content to viewers or lower their prices instead of constantly raising them.  Also the latest update only works on incredibly strong wifi connections rendering it pretty much useless...

title: A bug that needs to be addressed
review:
I have the iPhone X. 

When I open a movie or a show, in most cases, it doesn’t take up the full screen and I have to pinch two fingers out to make it fit. I’m ok with that. But if I pause the movie or show and leave the app and come back, I have to stretch it out for full screen again. I like to see the arrows come back to make it full screen or maybe even better would be if there was a app wide setting that says “ always show in full screen”. 

Thanks for listening.

title: Great app.
review:
I love the app. I would love to see the star system come back though. I also agree that there should be a forward button. 

That said, to everyone complaining about the content that is removed from Netflix. Netflix doesn’t remove the content to ”make space for new stuff”. It is removed because the licensing deal expired and Netflix could not come to a renewal deal with the content owner or did not seek a renewal because it wasn’t popular enough.

But its really just a low key way to push programs onto you. Just like netflix thought it would be a good idea to enable auto play so when you try to read the preview of a show it plays in the background with no way to shut it off. Dear netflix absolutely nobody likes this feature.

title: Fix how to prioritize downloads
review: Great app overall. The download feature is awesome for air travel. Only issue and reason I gave it 4 stars is that when downloading episodes of a show, the app prioritizes the last episode instead of the first. If I want to download episodes 1-3 of a show, why would it start with 3? I’m downloading this last minute for a flight, and I’ll probably run out of time and not be able to watch any of them since I’m not a psycho who watches episode 3 before 1 and 2. Everything else is great.

title: this is annoying!
review: so i love netflix i watch a lot of things on it but the most annoying problem now is the thumbs up and thumbs down rating feature! i just wanna say that i used to rate my favorite shows and movies after watching them with the star rating feature, and now because you guys changed the rating stars to the annoying thumbs up and thumbs down i NEVER rate anything anymore, because you can’t rate it telling that you like it partly or not that much! PLEASE CHANGE THE RATING BACK TO THE STARS!!!!! other then this rating feature problem everything is great!

title: Love Netflix but...
review: First off I want to say that I love Netflix and this will be one application that I will never stop using. However, I’m honestly tired of seeing the same movies listed month after month. Poorly rated movies I might add, which, not to sound like a snob, I will most likely not watch. About the only time the lists are updated a lot more regularly is throughout the holiday season. If it was updated like that throughout the rest of the year it would be a ton more enjoyable than it already is. The same applies for the children’s section as well. But that is really my only gripe and the only reason I’m rating Netflix for 2 stars.

title: Bad update
review: Netflix is a good app overall. I like how it has new movies and shows. Also, how I can download and watch movies on the go. In transition, the last couple of updates have negatively changed the app in many ways. First of all, many of the shows I used to watch like it Family Guy and the Simpsons were removed from Netflix. Also they didn’t even warn me when I was updating, that these shows would be removed. Secondly, the fast-forward buttons reduced in size. This makes it much harder to press it. The Netflix creators should consider these problems.

title: Organization
review: I have enjoyed netflix for about 7 years now. Picture quality and content have improved dramatically since then, however I have 2 complaints. One is the forced price increases, and most importantly the organization is terrible. Its like sorting through a 50 gallon tub of $5 movies at the store terrible. Please please please.... when you go to the "new movies" or "recently added" selections order the movies from the most recently added and newest to the oldest!!! I also would like "My list" to be that way because its common sense and easy to locate what you want.

title: Suggestion
review: I love Netflix, but that doesn’t mean there’s no room for improvement. I’m constantly worried that shows I want to watch but haven’t gotten around to watching are going to disappear. Well I thought a good suggestion could be for Netflix to add a “leaving soon” category. This would be movies that are going to be purged from the Netflix selection, that way if you scroll through and see something worth watching you’ll know to watch it soon!

title: Add an teen when you create a new profile
review: Add an age choice when you create an new profile because it is hard to get through other shows when it shows baby show unless you add it to your list so I think the you should make an toddler profile selection which should be 2 to 5 and an Kid section 5 to 8 and an teen section which should be 8 to 12. Because we keep going through toddler stuff which makes it hard to find your show or movie. Unless you search it up.

title: There is a problem
review: Hey Netflix!! This is an amazing app aside the fact it keeps crashing and asking for me to come back later when I would wait more than a few hours or wait a day. A notification pops up when I click a movie or show saying “network error” “there is a problem with Netflix try again later” my internet connection is fine and isn’t the issue I don’t believe. title: Sound lagging video on app
review: Recently the sound has been lagging the video on the app after watching for a little while. It’s odd, everything starts out fine, but then eventually the sound and the video don’t match and it is terribly annoying. The only way I have been able to get it to work again (for only a short time before it does it again) is by completely restarting my phone. I have tried it on multiple iPhones with the same result. I believe Netflix has got an issue that needs fixing. Please look into this. I am about to the point where I am going to have to quit using the app.

title: NEED button 2 select LANGUAGE
review:
PLEASE NETFLIX...SEE this & HEAR me!

I understand Netflix is used all over the world & there’s more and more multilingual content. That’s awesome.

However, I hate getting disappointed when I see a bunch of new content then I have to look at cast names etc to try and figure out if it’s in ENGLISH?? And then disappointed to find out THEY AREN’T!

I just can’t watch content w/ English dubbed voices or subtitles. I’m sorry. It’s so disappointing for me...good for the show’s language viewers...to see awesome looking shows then find out they’re not in English. 

For instance, I only prefer watching American, British, Australian English & even some Irish English shows. I’m sorry but that just me.

I & Ik many others ppl I talk to...NEED A  button/setting to FILTER ONLY English speaking shows...or Hispanic/Asian/Icelandic/Indian etc

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE 

See/consider & add this ability!!!!!!

Thanks Netflix!

JimmybOhio

title: Just a request

I’d very much appreciate it. & Thank you all so much for the work you put into making Netflix great! :)

title: Was better in the past

I’d like the opportunity to purchase before I’m trying to remember what’s no longer there. Also...I’d like my “watch it again” and continue watching to be the top two views and then new and popular. Thanks for reading this.

review:
Autoplay is a criminal offense that doesn’t need to be rehashed in a review.  What Netflix needs to do is implement granular user preferences that include the ability to disable this unwelcome, unwanted, unhelpful, and unhappy “experience”.   It’s particularly odious when browsing on Apple TV.

In addition, we need the ability to permanently block specific content.  e.g., I want to block any and all “Barbie” content.  Simple request, right?  Instead, Netflix heavily pushes this content to my kids - even though there isn’t a single instance of viewing in their history.

As much as we enjoy some of the Netflix experience, it’s the incessant PUSH to consume more content that diminishes the experience.

Recommendations are fine - except for when they are not - so a mechanism for manual control is conspicuously absent at this point.

I am >< this close to unsubscribing and deleting the app for these reasons.  

Because at the end of the day - Netflix is merely another time wasting entertainment app.  If it’s not enjoyable, what’s the point?  And the push push push to consume is NOT enjoyable.
title: Unacceptable

I don't know if it's a Netflix issue, a google issue or an iPhone issue, but the Netflix continually glitches when casting to Google Chrome cast.
When I open the app and cast to my Chrome cast it performed fine. But if my phone locks and I unlock it I can no longer control the cast. It freezes and continues to play. So I cannot pause, rewind or control it all. 
I give a 5 star because I love the app and all it provide. I just don't know who issue this is.

review:
Update (May 2020):

Nothing changed. Quality content is nonexistent or hard to find among mountains of F-rated stuff that is impossible to hide.

Update (Oct 2018):

After some years, still the same thing: can’t hide unwanted movies, choices are even more poor, but now there is more of netflix-branded mediocre run of the mill pulp fiction productions to dilute the choices or hide how bad the rest is, while Real Movies are nowhere to find. 

The streaming technology is good, but so is YouTube’s.

Older:

The selection of movies for streaming is very poor. 

I'd like to be able to hide movies that I've gotten tired to look at. For example, The Hunt for the Red October might be a good movie, but I've tired of seeing it in my list.

No user comments and recommendations (and don't even think of pointing me to Face-boo!)

Movie discovery facilities are practically non-existent in comparison to browser-based version of Netflix. There may be thousands of movies, but most of which I can discover have one or two star rating.

The old spirit of Netflix is (still) gone.
title: Poor, very poor.

review:
Netflix was great until we retired to the mountains. We don't have internet at out cabin so we download when we're in town so we can watch later at our cabin. We connect the phone, with the downloaded shows, to the TV but we only get audio. Even upgrading to the best plan doesn't allow us to see the video of our downloads.

Now we can only watch Netflix when we are in town.

We ARE able to watch downloads on the phone, but at our age we would need a phone as large as a TV to make it an enjoyable experience.

Hopefully, Netflix can find a way to allow us to continue to be customers.

UPDATE:
Just watch a show down loaded on my phone with the phone on ”Airplane” mode. It worked great! I love Netflix again.

I changed my two star rating to five.  Thanks Netflix.

I called Netflix support only to hear “we are currently having and overwhelming amount of service calls and are unable to help thank you for you patience” and the phone hung up. So currently, whoever signed in and changed my account info is obviously getting free Netflix. Very frustrated with this.

title: App is fine but selection is not
review: I like the app but the selection of movies and shows can be pretty mediocre. There isn’t really much I can say is on the app off the top of my head. It has a few great movies, but otherwise anything else on there is pretty forgettable and boring. I think that each time I check more movies are removed and changed, and these were the movies I was actually interested in. I don’t know how Netflix works on that front, but many shows and movies have gone the way of the dinosaur for reasons I don’t know or understand.

title: Bad
review: Netflix is great when it comes to the range of content, and that is why I’m giving it 2 stars. Searching for new movies, tv shows, etc. seems like a waste of time, as I cannot organize them by year. For $16 a month, I don’t understand why this is hard to fix. Every illegal movie website has this option, it is disappointing that a giant like Netflix doesn’t. Oh, and if you are paying for Ultra HD, you are not always going to get it, even if you set it to always be in HD. And when it comes to downloading, there are yearly limits, and some downloads delete themselves after a period of time. Step up Netflix.

title: Why you shouldn’t get rid of The Office:
review: You can not get rid of The Office it is a fantastic show and it just can’t go it can’t it’s is amazing and so good  to watch it was the show about people in an office and it was wonderful i know your probably not gonna listen to us but the people that I know for a fact do not want to office to go let me tell thee are many people on this world and half of the people I know witch IS A LOT of people say they can not live if THE OFFICE is off of Netflix.

title: I love Netflix but
review: You guys have been saying about fuller house that it’s supposed to come out in fall when it is fall end it hasn’t came out the new season and I’m mad because I’ve been waiting all month long and basically you put new movies and you put new episode of stuff in fuller house it doesn’t get the new season that’s a messed up but I love Netflix but the shows that you say that come out and for me to come out in fall because it is fall😡

title: Different review choice
review: Netflix is really neat for looking in to many categories and finding films & tv shows you’d never expect.  It gas a huge variety to choose from and there are always updates and new shows being added.  However, I think the rating for things you have watched is limiting. The ‘thumbs-up’ and ‘thumbs-down’ makes my reviews seem a but skewed. I really preferred having the number of stars because I would get more accurate feedback and suggestions I liked more.

title: Writers lack skill
review:
I usually enjoy the shows Netflix picks up when a major network cancels them. But lately it seems that the writers have lost their skills. A show Designator Survivor which I really enjoyed, I had to turn off and remove from my list. After watching for just less than ten minutes. Reason is the actors didn’t have as much to say as before. Really every other word being a vulgar curse word. The show used to have a cense of dignity. 

Anyway I hope that either the writers get a vacation or that they go back to school to learn how to write. Wake up and see that the work place is not and does not talk that way.

title: Why remove Airplay?
review: So I have a trailer and during trips I like to watch with loud sound. Seeing as I will disrupt my neighbors, I like to use Bluetooth while connecting to tv. Which means I need airplay. Now I can’t even use BT when connected to tv because they removed airplay. Not cool. Ok. If it’s not brought back soon, I’m cancelling my subscription and going elsewhere. On top of that, they have the nerve to increase the price?! Seriously? Bring it back please. Every other streaming service continues to have it. For what I pay for, I deserve to listen with my Bluetooth speakers while connected to the tv. Nice job Netflix. Keep it up and you will lose more customers like myself. Not happy I cannot AirPlay anymore.

title: Love it
review: I love Netflix but they put like some old movies and tv shows literally like 5 people out of the whole world will watch it and they will delete every other movie/show but that one and add more just like it. I feel Netflix should put more high rated movies like all Disney movies, good shows kids actually like watching like sponge bob and fairly odd parents, I suggest for older people like fresh prince of bel air or George Lopez. Things we, the people really enjoy watching.

title: Bad with Chromecast
review: The only reason I downloaded the phone app is because the vizio app on my tv frequently freezes where nothing but unplugging the tv fixes it. It’s not much better on my iPhone: if I back out of the app or even just turn my screen off after connecting and casting a show, the app will just get stuck in the connecting phase with chromecast even if I keep disconnecting and repeating. The only fix is exiting the app completely and restarting it. So every time I want to change what I’m watching I have to restart the app. A really irritating bug that has been around for too long to still be a thing.

title: Netflix hurry!
userName: VERY UPSET AND I MIGHT LEAVE
review: Ok don’t get me wrong Netflix is amazing! BUT I’ve looked everywhere else and Gotham season 4,5,6 is out but I can’t find it on Netflix we only have seasons 1,2,3! So what’s up with that why does Netflix take so long to give us 1 season at least!! I literally only got Netflix to watch Gotham and now hey aren’t even showing it! I’ve watched other things that were amazing too. But why is Gotham the only one that I haven’t got anymore seasons!!!🤧😭😔I just want more season of Gotham because I’ve been waiting 3 MONTHS for SEASON 4 to come on!!

title: I’m very mad but it’s a good app
review: You guys took off the good shows like Moana and family guy and wizards of waverly place and Hannah Montana etc.. this mad me very upset when I found this out this is not fair to people who watch these shows on a daily basis but it’s a good way to watch shows for cheap but seriously fix this issue because I’m ready to stop paying and not watch ur guys shows this is so not ok I hope you stop deleting shows and put back the ones people recommend you put back and get rid of the ones that people don’t like like cmon please figure this out

title: please change this!
review: netflix is good and all but the mobile app is really bugging me. i tried searching “IT chapter one” and nothing came up? i know for a fact that IT is on netflix. so i tried a different movie “Valerian” nothing came up but thats also on netflix but not when i search the movie name. i expect when i search the movie it either comes up with “no results” or it actually shows the movie/tv show not movies/tv shows that are CLOSE to what im trying to search. i want the ACTUAL movie without having to use my laptop or tv to watch it

title: Pairing movies
review: It would be great for there to be an option to start a party type thing within the account that two profiles can start and stop the movie so that they are in sync this would be great especially for someone like me who is in the military and have a kid at home so we can watch movies together instead of trying the difficult part of trying to start at the same time and pause at the same time

title: STOP REMOVING MY FAVORITE TV SHOWS!!
review: About a week ago I was watching a show called Meteor Garden, there are new episodes every week of this particular show so I was waiting, but now the entire show is gone. Netflix has gotten rid of Casper the friendly ghost as well. I also had 7 movies in my list but now I only have 3. What the heck?? Me and my family are very displeased with this pesky situation. Please do something to fix this. Besides this problem, Netflix isn’t bad. I can watch movies (that are on there) wherever I am. There is a nice amount of movies for adults and younger kids to enjoy anywhere.

title: I like it!
review: I like Netflix but there’s one thing I’m not the biggest fan of. Sometimes if I really like a show I want to watch the new and upcoming episodes. Not wait for a whole year for it to be on Netflix. For a while I’ve been waiting. Obviously I don’t have cable, nobody would have time to use it so what’s the point. Yes I do love watching all the episodes at one instead of waiting for a new episode after a week. Depends how much I like the show. Other then that I’m a big Netflix fan. Reasonable pricing for good shows/movies

title: Netflix won’t work on my IPhone 8
review: This is a great video subscription. It has great movies and TV shows, but it does have its problems. Ever since I got the latest update, I have not been able to watch Netflix. I have been trying for a few days now but it just keeps loading. After a while a error pops up. I have tried multiple different shows but the same error pops up. I know it’s not a internet problem because my brother watches Netflix on his Samsung Galaxy S6 and it works fine.

title: Good job
review: I often love to sit down and watch a good show or movie and somehow someway Netflix captured in that in a successful way although I do wish that Netflix and more option and a better search organization because sometime I want to look in tv comedy and I have to go to the tv then I have to scroll to the comedy section and get this little strip of shows and that can be frustrating sometime but other than them having to do a few fixes I do enjoy Netflix more that anything else to be honest

title: I Hope Everyone Understands
review: I love Netflix, and I use it more than any "movie & tv show" app. But I don't get why they don't put on every show & movie in the world! I know some apps that do that but I use Netflix more because i'm/ my parents are/ already signed in! I wanted to see if Victorious was on there. Nope. I went to see if Degrassi: The Next Generation was on there. Nope. I tried looking for Clarence. Was it there? NOPE. So I hope you understand & i'm still giving you guys a 5-star rating.

title: Awesome ! But not awesome...
review: I love most of the shows on Netflix they are really great BUT, they get rid of all the good ones so fast but leave all the bad ones... example: they are getting rid of once upon a time but leaving 3%?? Only problem with that is once upon a time is a super popular and good show. 3% doesn’t even have the lips synced but they aren’t getting rid of that show, other then that problem I love Netflix !!! I also believe that they should put more fairytale cartoons and stuff in there. Kids really love it.

title: Can't Even Log In Now
review: Netflix was good before it logged me out, without me even wanting to log out. I tried my best to log back in, using the correct password and email each time before getting hit with: Your email or password is incorrect. We had to reset our familys log-in to Netflix; same email, different password. It worked then, and it was great, but then it logged me out. Again. And I used the password and email that I always use for Netflix, and it still did not work. I hope you are able to fix this problem soon, as it is only a problem on my phone and not my TV. Thank you!

title: Pretty much awesome
review: Netflix is awesome they have a good selections of movies and shows, but with some of the shows it would be good if Netflix could go ahead and update to new season when they come out instead of people just waiting. It is a great app I strongly suggest getting it, you can binge watch pretty much anything. Love the huge selection, and how you can rate what you like then it will give you a percentage of the movie of how much you would like it. Great app 🧜🏻‍♀️

title: Upgrade?
review: I personally love Netflix. It’s awesome, inexpensive, and has many binge-worthy television shows. I just have one minor complaint; I wish that they would put better movies in the horror section. Now, don’t get me wrong, The Autopsy of Jane Doe is amazing, as well as some others, but the majority of this section is less then mediocre. I would enjoy Netflix even more if they added more horror movies, especially some of the classics, as well as the more modern horror movies.

title: Content a BIG issue
review: Why can’t you guys produce excellent movies without all the vulgar language and content!!! Or at least make categories where you can choose movies without it! Surely I am not by myself in thinking your made for Netflix movies are good, but always thinking “what if it didn’t have all the filth “ it would’ve been such a great movie. The best film makers of the golden oldies mastered it! Is it really necessary?  I have downgraded my service because I have children that were using the service and I can’t trust your choices of ratings. Obviously your agenda is to infiltrate our kids heads with filth. It’s hard for even adults to watch and your choices.

title: Netflix ❤️
review: I’ve loved Netflix for a long time, and I still do. I have a kids account, but I can’t watch one of my favorite movie series, Harry Potter. I also can’t watch another one of my favorites, Percy Jackson. I love so many movies, but I just can’t watch them with a kids account. But I also like tv shows and movies that are on Netflix. I love Greenhouse Academy, Tall Girl, and a lot more. I like Fuller House and that they came out with season 5 also. Netflix is great but with just a few problems that can probably be easily fixed.

title: Can this app count?
review:
I love most of this app but the automatic downloads of episodes in a series leave a lot to be desired.  My main complaint is there is no way to easily switch off the automatic downloading.  The second one is the app downloads too far in advance and also seems to skip an episode if it runs into trouble seeming never to attempt again.

Give me more control and trust me to download at my own pace.

If episode five failed and I am at episode two still retry five instead of episode 17.

title: #NetflixIsAwesome
review: Netflix, is my favorite app to watch my favorite movies! I have one complaint their should be more selections. For kids age 5 and under, kids ages 6 to 10, teens 11 to 14, ages 15 to 18, and adults. I still love Netflix though it is so much fun to sit in a car on a road trip and be able to watch fun tv shows! My favorites are Fuller House, Stranger Things, and A Series Of Unfortunate Events. Thank you Netflix for giving me and the rest of the world a great time to watch movies!

title: Netflix is great but...
review: I live Netflix and it is overall a great experience, but there is one thing that bugs me, but it’s not all that big of a thing. Sometimes I get bored of a show and finish a show but it stays on my continue watching list. This annoys me and I really wish there was a way to take the show off. For example I finished ‘the politician’ but it’s still on my continue watching list and it says s1 ep1 and that I already watched the episode.

title: Where is Jessie!?
review:
Yes Jessie is an “old” show, but tons of people love(d) that show, it would be great if you could bring it back ( especially with Cameron and everything )

But it’s not just Jessie its TONS of other shows that people love, what has happened to those I hope you can bring them back. My twin daughters who are now 11 love all the shows that you took away, yes “you can find them somewhere else.” But I think personally Netflix should put these shows back on.

Why you ask

Because Netflix has no ads, is what most people use, and I ALREADY PAID FOR IT! Netflix is great and has a wide selection of shows, yes.. but I think they should bring those shows back.

Netflix is great and has a VERY WIDE selection of shows, I did not state all of the good things about Netflix so I suggest that you download it, but this is just my opinion. 

Have a good day!

Thanks for taking the time to read this, From Blessing Davis.

title: Can’t Live Without It.
review: I’ve been a fan of Stranger Things since it first came out in 2016, and it’s truly changed my life. As a 15 year old myself, it’s great to follow a cast that are all just such an inspiration to me. And the show is just so well constructed. And ALL of my other top favorite shows, are ones that I’ve watched on Netflix. Such an amazing platform. (Not to mention they’ve helped so many actors & actresses really start up their careers) Keep up the good work🥰🥰

title: Amazing
review: Obviously this app is amazing. There are so many shows and movies that you can watch and if you have a kid you can add restrictions. Personally of course I watch “the office” 24/7 on Netflix. However there is one issue that I have never had before. I tried to re-watch “the unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt” and it let me watch the 1st season but now it wont let me watch any other episodes unless I download them. It’s a small bug and I’m not sure if anyone else has this problem but it’s very annoying.

title: Some movies/episodes don’t appear
review: Some times movies/series that have already came out on other people’s Netflix’s account don’t show up on mine the movie “something great”has been out since April 19th it is now June 11th and it’s still not on my account I have updated my Netflix account two times and the movie still isn’t there this is not the first time this has happened Netflix has great movies/series but I think the updates should be a little better and movie and episodes should come out at the same time on all Netflix accounts

title: Useless helpline
review: So I was having issues with the actual video loading. I was in my house, using Netflix on my phone. I restarted the app, tried again. I used other apps and my internet was fine. I called the help line and the 1st time I was disconnected after waiting a minute. The second time a guy picked up and stated I need to restart my phone. I told him I did, it didn’t help. So I asked if this issue is happening to anyone else, he said no. I asked if he had any other recommendations, he said no. He said the video uses a lot of internet and i might be experiencing a “buffer”—whatever that means. Anyways USELESS.  I processed to discount. I am canceling Netflix. The shows aren’t so great anymore either.

title: Amazing
review: Netflix is probably one of the tv apps I request most to everyone. You get everything from cartoons to live action horror films! The only downside, is Netflix does not have everything you could possible want to watch. But that’s normal, you can’t put every show in the world. My personal favorite things to watch on Netflix are Death Note, Black Butler, Voltron, Kakegurui, and The Umbrella Academy. The shows/movies range! Have fun finding your next show to watch!

title: Censorship is real and sadly Netflix is censoring movies they stream
review:
Sadly, censorship on Netflix is real and movies like “Root Cause”, are removed, without any merit or cause. I used to love my Netflix but now I’ll be looking for a company that is open minded, in this year of 2019, that allows any view or opinion to be heard and shown, which Netflix has made clear, by its actions, that it does not care for freedom of speech or the right of having a different view and opinion. This is not a privilege, it is a right to express freedom of speech and have the opportunity for any opinion and view to be heard and seen.

So 1 stars is obviously too high of a rating but it was impossible to choose anything lower or else it be 0 or worse.

title: Closed captioning
review: I love Netflix and I probably watch way more of it then I should, but I think it was with the new update that I have to switch closed captioning on on each individual episode I watch which is a real pain. I used to be able to switch it on and then binge the whole series with it on but now whenever i finish an episode and it goes to the next it automatically gets switched off and that’s just a real pain. Can you please make it so there is a preferred settings so I can just have it so CC is just on. Besides that the app is great thank you!

title: Was excellent now just ok
review: I do like that the app is updated regularly but newer features need to be able to be turned off if they aren’t needed. Specifically the ‘connect to device’ option in my case. Since it has been placed where the “back” button was previously it has become a constant irritation as it connects to our living room Roku constantly. There appears to be no way to disable it either. When speaking to Netflix they have no idea  what it is much less how to disable that feature (even with the requested photos).

title: Recommended? YES.
review:
Your flight has been delayed and your stuck in the airport. Bored and with nothing to do, this app is a lifesaver. This app offers all different types of shows and movies, all available on your mobile device. I love that I can, in a way, bring my TV with me in my pocket. I have never ran into a glitch or bug, everything runs smoothly, and, best of all, they give you a variety of cool pictures for your account photo. 

If you are concerned parent wondering if you can let your kid have this app, don’t worry! You can always put on the restrictions, which limits the content that your child watches on Netflix. 

Also, don’t forget this: 
You can only download episodes of shows/movies when you are on WiFi. 

But I definitely recommend this app for people of all ages! 😄😁🙂

title: I love it!! Please Read!
review: I totally love Netflix!! I love that you can download shows so you can watch them when you don’t have WiFi (I don’t have cellular data or 4G.) I definitely think that you should add more icons, such as Glitter Force and other various characters. Also, I would like to request more Pretty Cure shows! The only ones you have are Doki Doki and regular! I think that the original Pretty Cure and some of the newer installments would be great. Thank you!!

title: Updates
review: So there are a lot of great updates but the newest one is absolutely terrible it does not have the ability to rewind or fast forward by 30 seconds and it is no aesthetically pleasing when you click on the screen to fast forward or rewind. Honestly it ruined my favorite app because I can’t enjoy any of my shows with a pause and play button in the middle of the screen and everything I a new place.

I love Netflix. I am blind, and you guys have so many audio described programs that I cannot even believe it. I am really bummed out though. I really loved call the midwife, and the audio description was canceled on the last season so I have not even watched it. That is a show that audio description really helps with, so I don’t even want to try it. Other than that you guys do great and I don’t mind spending the money. Come on, audio described the last season of call the midwife’s and I will be your friend and supporter for life!
title: Blind viewer

review: I have been using Netflix for 6 years now. I love being able to watch my favorite tv shows and movies. The mobile app lets me download episodes from some of my shows and movies. Though not all movies and shows are for download I just with all of them are for download. I would love it if they could implement the feature where you can double tap the left or right of the screen to skip 5 seconds or more.

review: Ohhh at first i didn't like Netflix it didn't have nothing interesting for me but you guys have brought the best shows ever i been meaning to see isa tk+ seriously i love this show is one of my fav you guys just need you guys to put isa tkm now, i mean if you put the second part why not the first one too please...... i want you guys to put it there i will see these shows like forever i could repeat this 7 times in one year to be honest 😍 loving it
title: Getting better

review:
(I love the app, but right now it’s not working)
I’m not getting any error messages, I made sure my WiFi wasn’t the problem. I updated it, still nothing. Now I uninstalled the app, reinstalled it, and it still won’t work. I entered my account info after reinstalling (that bit works) but then it gets stuck on the loading screen forever (I’ve tried closing and opening the app many times)
title: It suddenly stopped working yesterday

review:
Netflix really needs to add the download offline for all shows! It only worked on some and not my favorites! Also I wish that they would tell us when shows are takin off because I was really disappointed when Hannah Montana was gone and more.
And add a lot of the newest and best tv shows and movies I know they have don’t really good so far. But the most important Thing so far is to have all the best new popular shows and to be able to download all shows
title: Awesome but could use improvement

review:
It would be nice if Netflix added a feature that would allow people to watch a show at the same time
One person would invite someone or a group to watch something and you could chat while you watched it. You would use your device and someone far away could watch it at the same time as you did and you could text at the same time. I think this would be a really cool idea
title: Add this please

review:
So, I watch this show called avatar the last airbander, my favorite carecter is Zuko. I wish I could change my profile to Zuko, plus I need to get  one of my siblings back for doing somthing to me. (he HATES avatar!) I understand if not, but I will give such a 5 star review, and if you have a donating thing, I will donate to that. Other than that, Netflix is awesome! It makes my day! Nothing like coming home from work to just sit back, relax, and watch Netflix.

                      ❤️Have a nice day!❤️
title: Really awesome! But no Zuko, so I am really disappointed 😭🥵

review: For a couple weeks or so the app design was finally good - I could go backward AND forward (which is SO awesome!!) 10 seconds, the play/pause button was in the middle of the screen instead of a teeny tiny button down on one side, and I could see where the volume was when I changed it (which is nice when in different situations), etc. But then it suddenly went back to the previous design where I could only rewind by 10 seconds, couldn’t fast forward, and couldn’t easily skip ahead to the next episode. What happened? Please change it back so we can go 10 seconds backwards & forwards, and play/pause in the middle of the screen.
title: App design suddenly changed

review:
This app always crashes & disconnects from my chromecast, especially at the time I’m asked “are you still watching” of course. If I want to change the volume after exiting the app, I have to wait for the app to reconnect which takes a while. Sometimes I have to restart my iPhone to get the cast icon to re-appear in the Netflix app so I can connect again, which is the most frustrating part.

Hulu’s app works & stays connected and I’ve never had to restart my phone to get the app to work. Please fix !!

Also, for Netflix in general: Most of the categories to select what to watch end up repeating the same show options multiple times; what’s the point?
title: App + casting drives me nuts

review: [Alright so I’ve had Netflix on my phone for quite sometime now and I’ve never had any trouble at all when it comes to crashes and bugs but I just noticed today when I tried opening the app, to my surprise it didn’t want to open up. This happened after the most recent update to this app. Can y’all please fix this issue?] Thank You guys for fixing this issue in the latest update!
title: [Sudden Crashing] Thank You

review: I was watching icarly and while I was watching it I realized there are episodes that are supposed to happen before I watch the others but I thought eh just my imagination but now I was watching Henry and the episode I watched gas or fail which Henry has powers but I didn’t watch the episodes when he got it then I look it up and there where more then one episode switched so now I have to look online to witch episodes to watch before I the episode after it. Please if you can fix this problem in shows.
title: Shows episodes are all mixed up

review: The app is great and all but when it comes to longer shows like anime, they will only show a couple seasons and then you can’t watch anymore of it in English or whatever language you speak.  On other channels or apps yes they have the full anime, but it’s in the language that it is originally made to speak which is why Netflix is really nice to watch stuff like that, but it doesn’t even show 2/3 of the full show.  (Example: One Piece, Naruto, and Fairytale are all examples of what I am talking about.)
title: Show More?

review: Most people who watch anime watch sub, but honestly I like to watch dub shows in Netflix like fairytale and more are awesome. So shows such as fairlytale and hunterxhunter have more episodes but Netflix just hasn’t added them. So if Netflix added those episodes then I feel like I’d enjoy Netflix a lot more. An anime I would really like Netflix to add is My Hero Academia. I would definitely recommend for pre teens and teenagers. I wish Netflix would add that and many more anime’s in dub and sub. Thank You.
title: Needs a few more shows

review: Subscribed to Netflix since nearly the beginning. Over time they have taken away actual reviews... dumbing them down in to stars... then further dumbing review process of titles in to thumbs up or down completely stowing the viewers ability to actually give meaningful feedback. So... there’s continual declination of the user experience over time. Now... they are creating films which they cloak as “documentaries” on child sexualization and exploitation and act surprised that people are upset. title: Great, BUT......
review:
We have enjoyed Netflix for a couple of years, but the recent change angers me. We now are having our shows interrupted with commercials. Also, many shows or movies cannot be seen without paying an additional monthly charge. That bothers me more than the commercials. 

When our monthly charge was recently increased, I accepted that as a normal cost increase, but an additional monthly charge doesn’t seem justified.

title: Colorado version of Pine Gap
review: Pine Gap (3.5 of 5) was moderately entertaining but I do believe you were on to something. How about modifying the storyline? Make it about the Colorado satellite surveillance station or mix it up by moving about the various satellite monitoring stations around the world — a few filmed street scenes to authenticate and the rest of the filming can be where ever you want. The drama does not have to just play out within but also storylines like wildfires threaten facility & homes of characters, raised threat levels causes lockdown, and there can always be a mole, spy or two and of course some romance love triangle.

title: Taking away the good and adding the bad

review:
The place I think is missing from the app on all platforms is the ability to access your watch list with a separate tab. I know that I would love to see my watch list in a grid view with multiple sort options. For example, sort alphabetically, genre, or date you added a title to the watch list.
For me it’s frustrating that I can’t find something in my watch list without scrolling for ages. There’s also times where I can’t remember a title from my lit and can access it with the image for the title.

**UPDATE TO REVIEW**

The app developers added the “My List” section as I described above. This feature works so smoothly and makes navigation so easy! I’m really impressed with it. 
You also don’t have to work to find the section.

Great update!

They no longer allow you to see the credits because you have to watch those stupid ads. To make it worse, flashing ads on the home page eat large amounts of screen real estate and cause headaches. Now add in constant nagging with red badges bugging you to look at what’s new. So called new stuff that now bugs you telling you what other people watch. I DON’T CARE WHAT OTHER PEOPLE WATCH! LEAVE ME ALONE TO PICK WHAT I WANT TO WATCH! 

NETFLIX HAS BECOME TOTAL ADVERTISING GARBAGE.
title: Endless advertising ruined Netflix

review: I can’t believe the number of people complaining!!!! If you don’t want your wife to see what’s in your “ previously viewed” section, don’t watch it!!!! Also, for all the people requesting more “teen” content, the reason you don’t see a teen section or a lot of teen content is because that’s not a important demographic to any studio this none are hardly made!! You guys are making history, keep it up Netflix!!!!!

review: I love Netflix. It’s where I watch all my movies, tv shows, and series. I have only 1 issue. Certain movies it will not let me play. I cannot figure out why. I’ve restarted my phone, undownloaded the app, and refreshed everything. I’m trying to watch Spencer Confidential. Continuously states, “connection error, please check connection and try again.”  But there is nothing wrong with my connection. Would like if this could somehow be fixed. Other than this, Netflix is great.

review: I really love Netflix and how it is set up and stuff but....a lot of the popular stuff or like everything that I’m watching just gets deleted, me and my mom used to watch switched at birth every night and then suddenly without a warning it got taken off, we never found any other shows just like it so now we never watch anything at night and lost our time together. Please if many people are still watching the show don’t deleted it
title: Good but stop deleting stuff

review: Don’t get me wrong I enjoy quite a few series and movies on Netflix, but not everything has to have a leftist agenda. Take “The Ranch” for example, one of the very few series that had good humor for the right, but had to end the series with everyone going left and being unamerican. Why? Why does every show now have to bombard us with propaganda that goes against our constitution, or have to have some social justice issue tied into it. Just make shows, that’s your job, it’s entertainment, not to sway the masses with your thoughts on every issue. I find it very irresponsible from Netflix to use their platform as a propaganda tool. It will only lose you business. Good luck.
title: Leftist agenda

review:
1 star for two reasons and I just canceled my service.

1) For no reason at all, they started emailing me In Spanish. Mind you, not in English and Spanish. No, just in Spanish. I live in the US. The common language here is English the last time I checked. And I don’t speak Spanish. Please take a note of that, Netflix, and fire your ML and Big Data teams. PS Not a Trump voter or supporter (before you jump to conclusions)

2) Try to do a screenshot of something truly relevant while watching a Netflix show and that you don't want to forget (a road sign, a locale, etc) and all you get is a black picture. Thanks a lot Netflix!! So I just have to freeze the frame and take a pic instead. How brilliant!!
title: Bye Netflix

review: I just recently got a brand new iPad Air. I tried to log into my account for Netflix on this iPad multiple times. I have tried reinstalling, restarting, etc. yet nothing works. I am positive I am using the correct email and password, as I logged out on both my phone and PlayStation to see if the log in info worked. It did on both. Each time I try to log in on this iPad it has a pop up that says “Sign in. Finish setting up your account to start watching your favorite TV shows and movies.” The only option to press is “OK.” So I press it. And all it does is put me back to the log in screen. Love Netflix but this app is useless for me.

Not only due they have the most titles. But often times they ones that were deleted off the US selection. And it’s not like their titles are just Canadian shows, they have all sorts of American shows on their as well. It’s ridiculous.

tl;dr Canada gets the best from Netflix
And never loses good shows.

You guys would have more variety if we were able to manually switch between country of origin. How can all seasons of AHS be in Spanish in Mexico but you only have two-three seasons with that option in the US?

I’m very dissatisfied by the new sign up method, and I’m sure a lot of people in my area are. Most people can’t even get access to the internet here much less cell service. Would really enjoy it if I could sign back up with my email.

review: Started out great initially, when launched. But as the price goes up, the movie selection goes down. Now there is the EXTREMELY ANNOYING nosy feature...very often, sometimes just minutes, the movie stops and “Are You Still There?” pops up on the screen, which has to be cleared to continue watching. I can’t let my little grandson watch a program by himself or do something constructive with my hands without washing and drying them, because I always have to do this. I pay for this service; who needs to know if my eyeballs are glued to it at the moment? Because of this, I am looking for something better now so I can drop Netflix for good.

Hi! Could you make a feature where two friends in different cities could both log in to their respective accounts and do a shared watch of a show? It should be totally synced and either friend should be able to push play/pause and it should stay synced.

Then the friends could chat on the phone while they watched their show! Or, you could even make a chat box and the friends could chat on the computer. That would be great! :)

review: I had an account and it was active. One day it  logged me out. I tried logging back in. I used my email and it said this email doesn’t belong to an account. Requests:

   Being from Europe, Georgia I don’t get a LOT of shows. While Americans can watch a bunch more than I can, we both pay the same exact price. It’s completely unfair and if I do want to watch American Shows/Movies I have to pay for a VPN service as well. Thanks.

title: Why block google?
review:
I like to watch videos while I browse online. I download the videos so I don’t use up my broadband. When I have Netflix open, I can’t access the Google site at all. I can go to bing, DuckDuckGo, etc. but can’t go to any Google webpage while the Netflix app is open. If I exit the app, I can, but can’t again if if open the Netflix app again. This seems deliberate.  

Lately, downloaded videos aren’t playing with an error msg saying it’s not available offline. Even when I just downloaded them a day or two before trying to watch and I can go back and download them again. Don’t trust your downloaded videos will be watchable offline.

title: “Are you still watching?” YES!!
review: Until this incredibly annoying feature can be toggled off by the user, this will always be a 3-star app. And unless Netflix starts listening to its customers, I’ll always be looking for a better streaming service and will jump ship the moment I find one, because not listening to your customers means no brand loyalty. Blockbuster learned this lesson the hard way; I wonder if Netflix will learn from their example or eventually become the next footnote in home entertainment history.

title: Network Error: There was a problem signing in. Please try again later.
review: I keep getting the same error message over and over. I have a brand new iPad, just got it last month. I have the latest iOS, just updated today. And yet this app simply does not work. The iPad is connected to WiFi and the Netflix app works fine on my iPhone on the same network, so it’s not my connection. Not sure why I’m paying for this service if I can’t even access it on my device.

Give us the power to filter the content you have and I’ll be using Netflix a lot more.

title: Works well, some UI issues with iPhone X
review:
I’ve never had any issues with Netflix as a streaming service. I have had great results binge watching my favorite series, even on my phone.

The only issue of late has been how the UI interacts to touch on the iPhone X. I spent a couple of minutes trying to figure out how to slide out of the app
(normal gestures) and found the whole UI while appearing vertical was actually horizontal for gesture use. This needs a tweak or at best, guide lines so we know orientation.

title: Weird Screen Glitch
review: I am a loyal Netflix fan, but when it comes to the app there are some issues. The most important (and annoying!) to me is that the peripheral vision when you increase the size of the screen shrinkens, which means that some of the pictures are cropped on the sides which gets really annoying especially when there are words on the screen that get chopped off. I am hoping that Netflix will fix it because it is really annoying and there are other minor glitches, but otherwise I love this app!

title: Continue watching
